TEXT.Italian: The businessman promises you a grateful deal if your nation will be the first one which has available a great arsenal in the New World. It will be clever to have some savings then.
TEXT.Spanish: The businessman promises you a grateful deal if your nation will be the first one which has available a great arsenal in the New World. It will be clever to have some savings then.

TEXT.English: Competent gunsmiths from Saint Petersburg could come to America and work for you.
TEXT.French: Deux armuriers compétents de Saint-Petersbourg peuvent venir aux Amériques et travailler pour vous.
TEXT.German: Zwei meisterhafte Waffenschmiede aus Sankt Petersburg können in die Neue Welt kommen, bietet Euch der Unterhändler an. Famos!
TEXT.Italian: Two competent gunsmiths from Saint Petersburg could come to America and work for you.
TEXT.Spanish: Two competent gunsmiths from Saint Petersburg could come to America and work for you.

TEXT.English: Soon the Russian sovereign is to marry the daughter of the Prussian king. Now he wishes to get rid of certain young varlets and assure their discretion.
TEXT.French: Bientôt le souverain russe va se marier à la fille du roi de Prusse. Il souhaite maintenant se débarrase de certains valets en toute discretion.
TEXT.German: Der russische Fürst heiratet in Bälde die Tochter des preußischen Königs. Vorab würde er gerne diskret einige junge Kammerdiener loswerden, deren Zutraulichkeiten jetzt nicht mehr erwünscht sind. Nun denn!
TEXT.Italian: Soon the Russian sovereign will marry the daughter of the Prussian king. Now he wishes to get rid of some young valets and their confidingnesses discretely.
TEXT.Spanish: Soon the Russian sovereign will marry the daughter of the Prussian king. Now he wishes to get rid of some young valets and their confidingnesses discretely.

TEXT.English: The Russian sovereign could order his ambassadors at European royal courts to report that your great arsenal is awe-inspiring.
TEXT.French: Le souverain russe peut ordonner à ses ambassadeurs en Europe de rapporter à quel point votre Grand arsenal est impressionnant.
TEXT.German: Der Fürst könne über seine Gesandten an den europäischen Höfen die Kunde verbreiten lassen, wie beeindruckend Euer Zeughaus sei und dass es selbst dem in Moskau fast gleichkomme. Das klingt schmeichelhaft!
TEXT.Italian: The Russian sovereign could order his ambassadors at European royal courts to report that your great arsenal is awesome.
TEXT.Spanish: The Russian sovereign could order his ambassadors at European royal courts to report that your great arsenal is awesome.

TEXT.English: This man seems to be a common hustler. Drastic steps are needful to change him into an honest citizen. He should surrender his wallet and put his nose to the grindstone.
TEXT.French: Cet homme semble être un arnaqueur. Des mesures drastiques seront nécessaire pour le changer en un honnête citoyen. Il devrait nous donner son portefeuille et mettre sa tête dans le guidon.
TEXT.German: Je länger der Unterhändler redet, desto halbseidener klingen seine Offerten. Euer Herz sagt Euch, dass dieser Mann ein Nepper ist, ein Schlepper, ein Bauernfänger! Ihr heißt Eure Gardisten, dem Gauner die Geldbörse abzunehmen und ihn zu hartem, aber ehrlichen Tagewerk zu zwingen.
TEXT.Italian: This man seems to be a hustler. Drastic steps are needful to change this guy into an honest citizen. He should deliver his wallet and put his nose to the grindstone.
TEXT.Spanish: This man seems to be a hustler. Drastic steps are needful to change this guy into an honest citizen. He should deliver his wallet and put his nose to the grindstone.

TEXT.English: Build a Great Tool Factory. Your citizens will be grateful.
TEXT.French: Construisez des Hauts fourneaux. Vos citoyens sauront vous être reconnaissants.
TEXT.German: Eine Vision nach meinem Geschmack! Wohlan, ich werde diese Große Eisenwarenfabrik errichten lassen, als erste Produktionsstätte dieser Art in Amerika. Natürlich erwarte ich, dass die Handwerkerschaft dieses Engagement honorieren wird ...
TEXT.Italian: Build a great tool factory. Your citizens will be grateful.
TEXT.Spanish: Build a great tool factory. Your citizens will be grateful.

TEXT.English: Cash is king ...
TEXT.French: L'argent est roi...
TEXT.German: Nur Bares ist Wahres ...
TEXT.Italian: Cash is king ...
TEXT.Spanish: Cash is king ...

TEXT.English: Why, no - I am only serving our community. Our guildmasters certainly feel the same patriotic spirit.
TEXT.French: Non merci - je ne fais que de servir notre communauté. Nos maîtres de guilde ressentent certainement le même esprit patriotique.
TEXT.German: Man muss mir nicht danken - ich danke der Bürgerschaft! Dafür, dass ich als Staatsmann unserem Gemeinwesen dienen darf. Ich bin mir sicher, dass die Gildenführer derselbe patriotische Geist beflügelt!
TEXT.Italian: Why, no - I am only serving our community. Our guild masters certainly feel the same patriotic spirit.
TEXT.Spanish: Why, no - I am only serving our community. Our guild masters certainly feel the same patriotic spirit.

TEXT.English: We need some skilled blacksmiths for our new factory.
TEXT.French: Nous avons besoin de forgerons qualifiés pour notre nouvelle usine.
TEXT.German: Jetzt gilt es, die große Fabrikhalle mit Leben zu füllen. Die Zunftmeister sollen ihre tüchtigsten Söhne fürs Schmiedehandwerk zur Verfügung stellen!
TEXT.Italian: We need some skilled blacksmiths for our new factory.
TEXT.Spanish: We need some skilled blacksmiths for our new factory.

TEXT.English: Our new factory will be an important part of our military industry. Give our workers uniforms!
TEXT.French: Notre nouvelle usine aura une importance stratégique pour le développement de notre industrie militaire. Donnez des uniformes à nos travailleurs !
TEXT.German: Diese Fabrik wird nicht nur unsere zivile Wirtschaft zum Brummen bringen, sondern auch die Fertigung kriegswichtiger Güter ankurbeln. Lasst die Arbeiter in Uniform an den Werkbänken ihren Dienst verrichten! Die Welt soll wissen, dass wir eine wehrhafte junge Nation sind.
TEXT.Italian: Our new factory will be an important part of our military industry. Give our workers uniforms!
TEXT.Spanish: Our new factory will be an important part of our military industry. Give our workers uniforms!

TEXT.English: Ah well, we shall allow them to keep up their traditions. This might even lead to more immigrants.
TEXT.French: Ah certes, nous devrions les laisser entretenir leurs traditions. Cela pourrait attirer de nouveaux immigrants.
TEXT.German: Wir werden sie ihre Tradition aufrecht erhalten lassen. Vielleicht führt dies ja soager zu weiteren Immigranten.
TEXT.Italian: Ah well, we shall allow them to keep up their traditions. This might even lead to more immigrants.
TEXT.Spanish: Ah well, we shall allow them to keep up their traditions. This might even lead to more immigrants.

TEXT.English: Your description of the celebration they plan does not sound very Christian. We cannot allow such heretical things.
TEXT.French: Vous décrivez une célébration qui ne semblent pas particulièrement chrétienne. Nous ne pouvons laisser une telle hérésie se propager.
TEXT.German: Die Beschreibung dieser Feierlichkeiten klingt nicht sehr christlich. Wir können keine Ketzerei in unseren Kolonien zulassen.
TEXT.Italian: Your description of the celebration they plan does not sound very Christian. We cannot allow such heretical things.
TEXT.Spanish: Your description of the celebration they plan does not sound very Christian. We cannot allow such heretical things.

TEXT.English: Send congratulations to the citizens.
TEXT.French: Féliciter les citoyens.
TEXT.German: Wunderbar! Lasst uns die kommende Nacht feiern und fressen.
TEXT.Italian: Invia le congratulazioni agli abitanti.
TEXT.Spanish: Que se felicite a los ciudadanos.

TEXT.English: We should establish internal trade with the locals for these rare commodities.
TEXT.French: Nous devrions établir des liens commerciaux avec ces paysans pour mettre la main sur ces produits rares.
TEXT.German: Gewiss. Nächstenliebe ist Christenpflicht! Die Wilden sollten uns allerdings solche Dienste anständig entgelten.
TEXT.Italian: Dovremmo stabilire un commercio con la gente del posto per avere questi rari prodotti.
TEXT.Spanish: Debemos establecer un intercambio interno con los lugareños a cambio de esos raros bienes.

TEXT.English: Respect the Native American tradition and reserve the medicine for their use.
TEXT.French: Respect the native american tradition and reserve the medicine for their use.
TEXT.German: Gewiss. Nächstenliebe ist Diplomatenpflicht! Die Wilden werden uns für die ihnen erwiesene Mildtätigkeit lieben.
TEXT.Italian: Respect the native american tradition and reserve the medicine for their use.
TEXT.Spanish: Respect the native american tradition and reserve the medicine for their use.

TEXT.English: Send a few men to follow them around without being noticed. The Natives might lead us to a hidden gem mine.
TEXT.French: Envoyez des hommes pour les suivre sans se faire repérer. Ils pourront nous emmener vers cette mine cachée.
TEXT.German: Lasst einige unsere Männer die Ureinwohner vorsichtig verfolgen. Sie führen uns vieleicht zu einer versteckten Edelsteinmine
TEXT.Italian: Send a few men to follow them around without being noticed. The Natives might lead us to a hidden gem mine.
TEXT.Spanish: Send a few men to follow them around without being noticed. The Natives might lead us to a hidden gem mine.

TEXT.English: Tell our men that we will respect the wishes of our Native friends. Nobody shall try to find out where thoses stones come from.
TEXT.French: Dîtes à nos hommes qu'ils doivent respecter la volonté de nos voisins. Personne ne doit chercher à trouver l'origine de ces pierres.
TEXT.German: Sagt unseren Leuten, dass wir die Wünsche unserer wilden Freunde respektieren werden. Es wird keine Nachforschungen geben.
TEXT.Italian: Tell our men that we will respect the wishes of our Native friends. Nobody shall try to find out where thoses stones come from.
TEXT.Spanish: Tell our men that we will respect the wishes of our Native friends. Nobody shall try to find out where thoses stones come from.

TEXT.English: We really regret this misunderstanding. We hope they will accept our retribution in gold and our promise that such an incident shall never happen again.
TEXT.French: Nous regrettons le mal-entendu. Nous espérons qu'ils accepteront une compensation en or et la promesse qu'un tel incident n'arrivera plus.
TEXT.German: Wir bedauern diesen Vorfall zutiefst. Wir hoffen, dass sie unsere Entschädigung in Gold und unser Versprechen annehmen, dass so etwas nie wieder vorkommen wird.
TEXT.Italian: We really regret this misunderstanding. We hope they will accept our retribution in gold and our promise that such an incident shall never happen again.
TEXT.Spanish: We really regret this misunderstanding. We hope they will accept our retribution in gold and our promise that such an incident shall never happen again.

TEXT.English: Sacred Trees? We must immediately call for a Missionary to drive out such devilish beliefs.
TEXT.French: Des arbres sacrés ? Nous devons appeler nos missionnaires pour les détourner de ces croyances païennes et les guider vers la lumière du Christ.
TEXT.German: Heilige Bäume ? Wir müssen nach einem Missionar schicken lassen, der diesen teuflischen Glauben austreibt.
TEXT.Italian: Sacred Trees? We must immediately call for a Missionary to drive out such devilish beliefs.
TEXT.Spanish: Sacred Trees? We must immediately call for a Missionary to drive out such devilish beliefs.

TEXT.English: We are very sorry, but the tree has been cut and nothing we can do will reverse that.
TEXT.French: Nous sommes sincèrement désolé, mais ces arbres ont été abattus maintenant et nous ne pouvons plus rien faire contre ça.
TEXT.German: Wir bedauern, aber der Baum wurde bereits gefällt und wir können das leider nicht rückgängig machen.
TEXT.Italian: We are very sorry, but the tree has been cut and we can do nothing to revert that.
TEXT.Spanish: We are very sorry, but the tree has been cut and we can do nothing to revert that.

TEXT.English: Their threats be damned! Send a raiding party to recover the beasts and put the ruffians to justice!
TEXT.French: Qu'ils aillent au diable ! Envoyez un raid pour récupérer les bêtes et remettre les bandits à la justice !
TEXT.German: Wir geben nichts auf solche Drohungen! Entsenden eine Truppe um diese Verbrecher der Gerechtigkeit zuzuführen und die Pferde zurückzubringen!
TEXT.Italian: Their threats be damned! Send a raiding party to recover the beasts and put the ruffians to justice!
TEXT.Spanish: Their threats be damned! Send a raiding party to recover the beasts and put the ruffians to justice!

TEXT.English: We could use a few enterprising young lads like these. Offer them the horses and a pardon if they agree to join us as (somewhat) law-abiding citizens.
TEXT.French: Nous pourrions utiliser quelques jeunes hommes entreprenants comme ceux-ci. Offrez-leur les chevaux et une grâce si ils acceptent de se joindre à nous en tant que citoyens plus respectueux des lois.
TEXT.German: Lasst uns diesen armen Seelen einen anderen Weg aufzeigen. Bietet ihnen an die Pferde zu behalten, wenn Sie deren Wert bei uns abarbeiten.
TEXT.Italian: We could use a few enterprising young lads like these. Offer them the horses and a pardon if they agree to join us as (somewhat) law-abiding citizens.
TEXT.Spanish: We could use a few enterprising young lads like these. Offer them the horses and a pardon if they agree to join us as (somewhat) law-abiding citizens.

TEXT.English: Offer him a deal. We will sell him enough horses at a low price to start breeding. In return, he shall regularly bring us a horse from his best stock.
TEXT.French: Proposez lui un marché. Nous lui vendrons suffisamment de chevaux pour à un prix bas pour qu'il puisse commencer son affaire. En échange, il devra nous fournir régulièrement avec ses meilleurs chevaux.
TEXT.German: Bietet dem Mann einen Handel an. Wir werden ihm genug Pferde für seine Zucht zu einem sehr niedrigen Preis verkaufen. Im Gegenzug soll er uns ab und zu eines seiner besten Zuchtpferde bringen.
TEXT.Italian: Offer him a deal. We will sell him enough horses to start breeding for a low price. In return, he shall regularly bring us a horse of his best breed.
TEXT.Spanish: Offer him a deal. We will sell him enough horses to start breeding for a low price. In return, he shall regularly bring us a horse of his best breed.

TEXT.English: It is a pity, but we don't have any horses we could spare.
TEXT.French: C'est dommage mais nous ne disposons pas de suffisamment de chevaux pour l'aider.
TEXT.German: Leider haben wir keine Pferde, die wir einfach abgeben könnten.
TEXT.Italian: It is a pity, but we don't have any horses we could spare.
TEXT.Spanish: It is a pity, but we don't have any horses we could spare.

TEXT.English: Unnecessary and preposterous! My good sir, we are more than capable of handling the fur trade ourselves.
TEXT.French: Inutile et absurde ! Votre Majesté, nous sommes tout à fait en mesure de gérer notre commerce de fourrures par nous-mêmes.
TEXT.German: Absurd! Wir sind mehr als fähig den Pelzhandel im Sinne Ihrer Majestät zu führen.
TEXT.Italian: Preposterous! My good sir, we are more than capable of handling the fur trade ourselves.
TEXT.Spanish: Preposterous! My good sir, we are more than capable of handling the fur trade ourselves.

TEXT.English: As you wish. Of course, I assume a portion of the first year's dividend will be reserved for me.
TEXT.French: Si tel est votre volonté. Bien entendu, j'imagine qu'une partie du dividende de première année me sera réservé.
TEXT.German: Wie Ihre Majestät wünscht. Wir nehmen aber an, dass ein gerechter Anteil der Gewinne an uns übertragen wird.
TEXT.Italian: As you wish. Of course, I assume a portion of the first year's dividend will be reserved for me.
TEXT.Spanish: As you wish. Of course, I assume a portion of the first year's dividend will be reserved for me.

TEXT.English: Please grant an audience to this promising new artist so that we may decide how best to make use of their talents.
TEXT.French: Accorder une audience à ce nouvel artiste prometteur afin de déterminer la meilleure façon d'utiliser ses talents.
TEXT.German: Gewährt den viel versprechenden neuen Künstlern eine Audienz, damit wir entscheiden können, wie wir ihre Talente am besten nutzen können.
TEXT.Italian: Accorda udienza a questo nuovo artista, in modo che possiamo decidere come meglio usare i suoi talenti.
TEXT.Spanish: Que se le conceda una audiencia a este prometedor nuevo artista para que podamos decidir cómo aprovechar mejor su talento.

TEXT.English: They'll be ready when they're ready. Or perhaps His Highness would like personally to lend a hand to the work effort?
TEXT.French: La cargaison sera prête quand elle sera prête. Ou peut-être que Son Altesse est prête à donner un petit coup de main ?
TEXT.German: Wir geben unser Bestes, doch es geht nicht schneller. Anstatt uns zu belästigen könnten die Abgesandten seiner Majestät ja selbst Hand anlegen.
TEXT.Italian: They'll be ready when they're ready. Or perhaps His Highness would like to personally lend a hand to the work effort?
TEXT.Spanish: They'll be ready when they're ready. Or perhaps His Highness would like to personally lend a hand to the work effort?

TEXT.English: Our humblest apologies to the Court for the unforeseen delay - perhaps this small contribution will compensate for the inconvenience?
TEXT.French: Nos plus humbles excuses à la Cour pour ce délai totalement imprévu - nous vous proposons un petit rabais en guise de compensation ?
TEXT.German: Unsere untertänigsten Entschuldigungen an den Hof für diese unvorhergesehene Verzögerung. Möge diese kleine Entschädigung diese Unannehmlichkeit vergessen lassen.
TEXT.Italian: Our humblest apologies to the Court for the unforeseen delay - perhaps this small contribution will compensate for the inconvenience?
TEXT.Spanish: Our humblest apologies to the Court for the unforeseen delay - perhaps this small contribution will compensate for the inconvenience?

TEXT.English: We can sell the precious jade for additional profit.
TEXT.French: Nous pourrions vendre ce précieux jade pour accroître nos profits.
TEXT.German: Das klingt famos! Lasst diese Steine zerkleinern, zurechtschnitzen und polieren. Und bietet sie den Heiden zum Handel an.
TEXT.Italian: Possiamo vendere la preziosa giada e guadagnare qualcosa in più.
TEXT.Spanish: Podemos vender el preciado jade para beneficiarnos un poco.

TEXT.English: Organize a replanting effort.
TEXT.French: Organiser une campagne de reboisement.
TEXT.German: Verpflichtet so viele helfende Hände wie Ihr findet, um die Feuersbrunst zu löschen.
TEXT.Italian: Organizza un rimboschimento.
TEXT.Spanish: Que empiecen las tareas de repoblación forestal.

TEXT.English: We are too pressed to spare any aid.
TEXT.French: Nous n'avons pas assez d'argent pour offrir notre aide.
TEXT.German: Schlimme Kunde. Schnell! Spurt euch! Ich brauche sofort einen Schnaps gegen den Schrecken.
TEXT.Italian: Siamo troppo sotto pressione per inviare aiuti.
TEXT.Spanish: Estamos demasiado apurados como para prestarles ayuda.

TEXT.English: Another fire broke out because we did not properly extinguish the first fire.
TEXT.German: Ein weiteres Feuer ist ausgebrochen, weil wir das vorherige nicht gelöscht hatten.

TEXT.English: Another fire broke out because we did not properly extinguish the first fire.
TEXT.German: Ein weiteres Feuer ist ausgebrochen, weil wir das vorherige nicht gelöscht hatten.

TEXT.English: By all means, Sir; we did not wish to anger the Crown.
TEXT.French: Nous ne souhaitons pas déplaire au Roi, quoi qu'il arrive.
TEXT.German: Um Himmels Willen, wir würden niemals absichtlich Ihre Majestät verärgern!
TEXT.Italian: By all means, sir; we did not wish to anger the Crown.
TEXT.Spanish: By all means, sir; we did not wish to anger the Crown.

TEXT.English: Do your worst! These scheming ministers will never be satisfied till they wring every last drop of wealth from our honest citizens.
TEXT.French: Faites donc au pire ! Ces ministres intrigants ne seront jamais satisfaits tant qu'ils n'auront pas sucer la dernière goutte de sang de nos honnêtes citoyens.
TEXT.German: Wir erwarten euer Schlimmstes! Die gierigen Abgesandten Ihrer Majestät werden eh nie zufrieden sein, bevor sie unsere armen Bürger gänzlich geplündert haben.
TEXT.Italian: Do your worst! These scheming ministers will never be satisfied till they wring every last drop of wealth from our honest citizens.
TEXT.Spanish: Do your worst! These scheming ministers will never be satisfied till they wring every last drop of wealth from our honest citizens.

TEXT.English: Fascinating! Capture some of these Amazons and organize an exhibition. We can be proud that the New World is full of such amazing wonders.
TEXT.French: Fascinant ! Capturez donc quelques-uns de ces amazones et organisons une exposition. Nous pouvons être fiers des merveilles dont recèlent ce Nouveau Monde.
TEXT.German: Faszinierend! Fangt ein paar der Amazonen ein und stellt sie zur Schau. Wir können stolz darauf sein, dass unsere neue Heimat solche Wunder birgt.
TEXT.Italian: Fascinating! Capture some of these Amazons and organize an exhibition. We can be proud that the New World is full of such amazing wonders.
TEXT.Spanish: Fascinating! Capture some of these Amazons and organize an exhibition. We can be proud that the New World is full of such amazing wonders.

TEXT.English: Women with weapons? Naked? This is profane! Send out our missionaries to convert and clothe these heathens.
TEXT.French: Des femmes avec des armes ? Nues ? C'est une profanation ! Envoyez nos missionnaires pour habiller et convertir ces pêcheresses.
TEXT.German: Frauen mit Waffen? Nackt? Das ist fürwahr gotteslästerlich. Schickt unsere Missionare, diese Heidinnen zu bekehren und zu bekleiden.
TEXT.Italian: Women with weapons? Naked? This is profane! Send out our missionaries to convert and clothe these heathens.
TEXT.Spanish: Women with weapons? Naked? This is profane! Send out our missionaries to convert and clothe these heathens.

TEXT.English: We will teach them manners! Send a troop of soldiers, let them mount their bayonets and bring me all silver they can find.
TEXT.French: Nous allons leur apprendre nos manières ! Envoyez une troupe de soldats armés de bayonnettes et ramenez tout l'argent que vous trouverez.
TEXT.German: Wir werden diese Weiber schon Mores lehren. Schickt einen Trupp Soldaten los und lasst sie die Bajonette aufpflanzen. Und bringt mir alles Silber, das Ihr finden könnt.
TEXT.Italian: We will teach them manners! Send a troop of soldiers, let them mount their bayonets and bring me all silver they can find.
TEXT.Spanish: We will teach them manners! Send a troop of soldiers, let them mount their bayonets and bring me all silver they can find.

TEXT.English: An intriguing discovery! The scholars at the Royal court will be fascinated. Let the scout write down his adventures and send the report to Europe.
TEXT.French: Une découverte intrigante ! Les savants de la cour Royale seront sans doute fascinés. Demandez à notre éclaireur d'écrire ses avantures pour en faire le rapport en Europe.
TEXT.German: Eine beachtliche Entdeckung! Das wird die Gelehrten am Königlichen Hofe interessieren. Lasst den Späher sein Abenteuer niederschreiben und bringt den Bericht nach Europa. Und schickt den guten Mann dann gleich wieder in die Wildnis.
TEXT.Italian: An intriguing discovery! The scholars at the Royal court will be fascinated. Let the scout write down his adventures and send the report to Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: An intriguing discovery! The scholars at the Royal court will be fascinated. Let the scout write down his adventures and send the report to Europe.

TEXT.English: Let them blow off some steam. The situation will soon normalize.
TEXT.French: Laissez les donc dépenser leur énergie. La situation se normalisera à nouveau plus tard.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie etwas Dampf ablassen. Die Situation wird sich bald wieder beruhigen.
TEXT.Italian: Let them blow off some steam. The situation will soon normalize again.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them blow off some steam. The situation will soon normalize again.

TEXT.English: We must show a firm hand! Send the troops to break apart this crowd and lock up all troublemakers over night.
TEXT.French: Nous devons montrer notre intransigeance ! Envoyez les troupes pour disperser la foule et emprisonner les perturbateurs dans la nuit.
TEXT.German: Wir müssen hart durchgreifen. Entsendet die lokalen Truppen um die Menge auseinanderzutreiben. Alle Unruhenstifter sollen über Nacht eingesperrt werden.
TEXT.Italian: We must show a hard hand! Send the troops to break apart this crowd and imprison all troublemakers over night.
TEXT.Spanish: We must show a hard hand! Send the troops to break apart this crowd and imprison all troublemakers over night.

TEXT.English: Well, then sell them the supplies they came for.
TEXT.French: Bien. Vendons leurs ce dont ils ont besoin.
TEXT.German: Dann verkauft ihnen die Vorräte, die sie wollen.
TEXT.Italian: Well, then sell them the supplies they came for.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, then sell them the supplies they came for.

TEXT.English: They would surely make great Scouts. Try to hire them.
TEXT.French: Ils pourraient sans doute faire de très bons éclaireurs. Essayez de les engager.
TEXT.German: Sie wären us sicherlich als Kundschafter sehr dienlich.
TEXT.Italian: They would surely make great Scouts. Try to hire them.
TEXT.Spanish: They would surely make great Scouts. Try to hire them.

TEXT.English: Try to convince them to join our forces as Rangers.
TEXT.French: Essayez de les convaincre de rejoindre nos forces en tant que gardes-forestiers.
TEXT.German: Versucht sie zu überzeugen unseren Truppen als Rangers zu dienen.
TEXT.Italian: Try to convince them to join our forces as Rangers.
TEXT.Spanish: Try to convince them to join our forces as Rangers.

TEXT.English: Organize a rebuilding effort with emphasis on improved mining safety measures.
TEXT.French: Organiser la reconstruction en prenant soin d'améliorer les conditions de sécurité.
TEXT.German: Schickt unverzüglich Männer hin, dass sie die Mine sichern. Dort soll möglichst bald die Arbeit wieder aufgenommen werden! Kosten spielen keine Rolle.
TEXT.Italian: Organizza la ricostruzione, ponendo l'enfasi sulla sicurezza della miniera.
TEXT.Spanish: Organizad un plan de reconstrucción, y haced especial hincapié en mejorar la seguridad de la mina.

TEXT.English: Send emissaries to assist the bereaved.
TEXT.French: Envoyer des émissaires pour aider les familles des victimes.
TEXT.German: Sendet vorübergehend ein paar Männer hin, um an der Unglücksstelle für Ruhe und Ordnung zu sorgen.
TEXT.Italian: Invia degli emissari per aiutare gli sfollati.
TEXT.Spanish: Que se envíen emisarios a ayudar a los afectados.

TEXT.English: We are too pressed to spare any aid for the city.
TEXT.French: Nous n'avons pas assez d'argent pour aider la ville.
TEXT.German: Man kann sich als Gouverneur wirklich nicht um alles kümmern! Man hat auch noch ein Privatleben. Ich muss mich zum Beispiel um das Wohlergehen meiner jungen Köchin kümmern.
TEXT.Italian: Siamo troppo sotto pressione per inviare aiuti alla città.
TEXT.Spanish: Estamos demasiado escasos como para prestar ayuda alguna a la ciudad.

TEXT.English: That is outrageous. Instantly free the Missionary. A man of the church cannot have done such things.
TEXT.French: C'est une outrage ! Libérez immédiatement le missionnaire. Un homme de Dieu ne peut se laisser à de pareils perversions.
TEXT.German: Das ist unerhört. Befreit den Missionar sofort. Ein Mann der Kirche kann sich doch solcher Taten nicht schuldig gemacht haben.
TEXT.Italian: That is outrageous. Instantly free the Missionary. A man of the church cannot have done such things.
TEXT.Spanish: That is outrageous. Instantly free the Missionary. A man of the church cannot have done such things.

TEXT.English: Well, our Native friends have no reason to lie. We will punish the man. He shall never work as a Missionary or a Priest again.
TEXT.French: Bon, nos amis indigènes n'ont pas de raison de mentir. Nous allons le punir. Il n'exercera plus jamais la fonction de missionnaire ou de prêtre.
TEXT.German: Nun, unsere wilden Freunde haben keinen Grund zu lügen. Wir werden den Mann bestrafen. Er wird natürlich auch nie wieder ein kirchliches Amt inne haben.
TEXT.Italian: Well, our Native friends have no reason to lie. We will punish the man. He shall never work as a Missionary or a Priest again.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, our Native friends have no reason to lie. We will punish the man. He shall never work as a Missionary or a Priest again.

TEXT.English: Of course we will help. Try to stabilize him. We will send one of our doctors with medicine immediately.
TEXT.French: Bien sûr que nous allons aider. Essayez de le stabiliser. Nous allons dépêcher l'un de nos médecins immédiatement.
TEXT.German: Natürlich werden wir helfen. Versucht ihn zu stabilisieren, bis ein Arzt mit Medikamenten eintrifft.
TEXT.Italian: Of course we will help. Try to stabilize him. We will send one of our doctors with medicine immediately.
TEXT.Spanish: Of course we will help. Try to stabilize him. We will send one of our doctors with medicine immediately.

TEXT.English: We will help this young warrior. But tell the Natives that this is costly and that they shall send some food to our nearest city in exchange.
TEXT.French: Nous allons aider ce jeune guerrier. Les indigènes devront cependant prendre en charge les frais élevés que cela représente en envoyant de la nourriture à notre ville la plus proche.
TEXT.German: Wir werden dem jungen Kriegern helfen. Als Gegenleistung sollen die Ureinwohner aber etwas Nahrung in unsere nächste Stadt schicken.
TEXT.Italian: We will help this young warrior. But tell the Natives, that this is costly and that they shall send some food to our next city in exchange.
TEXT.Spanish: We will help this young warrior. But tell the Natives, that this is costly and that they shall send some food to our next city in exchange.

TEXT.English: Do whatever you can to save his life. If he survives, remind him that he has a blood debt to us.
TEXT.French: Faîtes ce que vous pouvez pour lui sauver la vie. S'il survie, rappelez lui sa dette de sang envers nous.
TEXT.German: Tut was immer ihr könnt um sein Leben zu retten. Wenn er überlebt, erinnert ihn daran dass er uns gegenüber eine Blutschuld trägt.
TEXT.Italian: Do whatever you can to save his life. If he survives, remind him that he has a blood debt to us.
TEXT.Spanish: Do whatever you can to save his life. If he survives, remind him that he has a blood debt to us.

TEXT.English: Well, those Slaves have to be returned to our European neighbour again. It is the law.
TEXT.French: Ces esclaves doivent être rendus à leur maître. C'est la loi.
TEXT.German: Wir müssen dem Gesetz Folge leisten und die Sklaven wieder unserem Nachbarn übergeben.
TEXT.Italian: Well, those Slaves have to be returned to our European neighbour again. It is the law.
TEXT.Spanish: Well, those Slaves have to be returned to our European neighbour again. It is the law.

TEXT.English: Those slaves are now ours. Our neighbour will not dare to attack a Monastery.
TEXT.French: Ces esclaves sont mainenant les nôtres. Nos voisins n'oseront pas attaquer un monastère.
TEXT.German: Die Sklaven gehören nun uns. Unser Nachbar wird es nicht wagen ein Kloster anzugreifen.
TEXT.Italian: Those slaves are now ours. Our neighbour will not dare to attack a Monastery.
TEXT.Spanish: Those slaves are now ours. Our neighbour will not dare to attack a Monastery.

TEXT.English: We will buy the freedom of those poor souls and give them the chance to live as free men.
TEXT.French: Nous achèterons la liberté de ses pauvres hommes et nous leur laissons une chance de vivre parmi nous.
TEXT.German: Wird werden die Sklaven freikaufen und ihnen eine Chance geben wieder als freie Menschen zu leben.
TEXT.Italian: We will buy those poor souls free and give them a chance to live as free men again.
TEXT.Spanish: We will buy those poor souls free and give them a chance to live as free men again.

TEXT.English: Sell them some of our food for a fair price.
TEXT.French: Vendez leur de la nourriture à un prix qu'ils trouveront honnête.
TEXT.German: Verkauft ihnen ein wenig unserer Nahrungsvorräte.
TEXT.Italian: Sell them some of our food for a fair price.
TEXT.Spanish: Sell them some of our food for a fair price.

TEXT.English: Give them half of the food we have stored in the next city for free.
TEXT.French: Faîtes leur don de la moitié de la nourriture stockée dans la ville la plus proche.
TEXT.German: Schenkt ihnen die Hälfte der Nahrungsvorräte der am Nächsten gelegenen Stadt.
TEXT.Italian: Give them half of the food we have stored in the next city for free.
TEXT.Spanish: Give them half of the food we have stored in the next city for free.

TEXT.English: It was a hard winter for ourselves as well. We cannot spare any of our food.
TEXT.French: L'hiver a été dur pour nous aussi. Nous ne pouvons pas nous priver de notre nourriture.
TEXT.German: Es war auch für uns ein harter Winter. Wir können keine Nahrung erübrigen.
TEXT.Italian: It was a hard winter for ourselves as well. We cannot spare any of our food.
TEXT.Spanish: It was a hard winter for ourselves as well. We cannot spare any of our food.

TEXT.English: God bless our brave miners! Relay to them my heartfelt gratitude. And then put them back to work around the clock! We need that silver urgently!
TEXT.French: Récolter les fruits de notre réussite !
TEXT.German: Gepriesen seien diese wackeren Kerle. Richtet ihnen meinen Dank aus! Und lasst sie dann rund um die Uhr schuften, um das Silber rasch einzubringen.
TEXT.Italian: Incassa il premio del nostro successo!
TEXT.Spanish: ¡Que se guarde este triunfo en nuestro tesoro!

TEXT.English: A capital idea! But remember we expect good returns on our investment capital.
TEXT.French: Excellente idée ! Mais rappelez-vous que nous attendons un bon retour sur le capital investi.
TEXT.German: Eine hervorragende Idee! Wir erwarten jedoch gute Erträge unserer Investition.
TEXT.Italian: A capital idea! But remember we expect good returns on the capital invested.
TEXT.Spanish: A capital idea! But remember we expect good returns on the capital invested.

TEXT.English: Our Native Mercenary shall stay for some time. Gaining further knowledge is always a good idea.
TEXT.French: Notre mercenaire peut rester quelques temps. Gagner davantage de connaissances est toujours une bonne chose.
TEXT.German: Der Indianischen Söldner kann ruhig eine Weile in dem Dorf bleiben. Der Austausch von Wissen ist immer sinnvoll.
TEXT.Italian: Our Native Mercenary shall stay for some time. Gaining further knowledge is always a good idea.
TEXT.Spanish: Our Native Mercenary shall stay for some time. Gaining further knowledge is always a good idea.

TEXT.English: That is not possible. This Native Mercenary is urgently needed elsewhere.
TEXT.French: Ce n'est pas possible. On a besoin immédiatement de notre unité de mercenaire.
TEXT.German: Das ist leider nicht möglich. Der Indianischen Söldner wird dringend an anderer Stelle gebraucht.
TEXT.Italian: That is not possible. This Native Mercenary is urgently needed elsewhere.
TEXT.Spanish: That is not possible. This Native Mercenary is urgently needed elsewhere.

TEXT.English: Our ladies won't become arsonists. Ignore them.
TEXT.French: Nos dames ne deviendront pas des incendiaires. Ignorez-les.
TEXT.German: Viel Rauch um nichts! Unsere Damen sind zu tugendhaft, um zu Brandstifterinnen zu werden.
TEXT.Italian: Our ladies won't become aronists. Ignore them.
TEXT.Spanish: Our ladies won't become aronists. Ignore them.

TEXT.English: Take a letter to their leader. She will get a fancy hat with ostrich feathers if this riot is over by tomorrow!
TEXT.French: Adressez une lettre à leur meneuse. Nous lui offrons un joli chapeau avec des plumes d'autruche si la manifestation s'achève avant demain !
TEXT.German: Bringt der Rädelsführerin eine Botschaft. Wenn sie die anderen Frauenzimmer zum Einlenken bewegen kann, lasse ich ihr aus Europa einen sündhaft schönen Hut mit Straußenfedern schicken.
TEXT.Italian: Take a letter to their leader. She will get a fancy hat with ostrich feathers if this riot is over by tomorrow!
TEXT.Spanish: Take a letter to their leader. She will get a fancy hat with ostrich feathers if this riot is over by tomorrow!

TEXT.English: Our ladies have a fiery temperament. Send soldiers to bring them back into line!
TEXT.French: Nos femmes ont un tempérament de feu. Envoyer des soldats pour ramener l'ordre !
TEXT.German: Das klingt brandgefährlich. Lasst Truppen ausrücken, sie sollen die Weiber zur Raison bringen.
TEXT.Italian: Our ladies have a fiery temperament. Send soldiers to bring them back to terms!
TEXT.Spanish: Our ladies have a fiery temperament. Send soldiers to bring them back to terms!

TEXT.English: Obstreporous nonsense! Spread the nets wide!
TEXT.French: Cela n'a absolument aucun sens ! Jetez les filets à la mer !
TEXT.German: Was für ein Schwachsinn! Werft die Netze weit aus!
TEXT.Italian: Obstreporous nonsense! Spread wide the nets!
TEXT.Spanish: Obstreporous nonsense! Spread wide the nets!

TEXT.English: Verily, we must be wise stewards of the sea. Let us set strict limits for the remainder of the season.
TEXT.French: C'est très juste. Nous sommes les garants du fragile équilibre de la mer. Nous devons imposer une limite de pêche pour la saison.
TEXT.German: Wahrhaftig, wir sollten auf die weisen Männer hören. Lasst uns strenge Fangquoten für die restliche Saison festlegen.
TEXT.Italian: Verily, we must be wise stewards of the sea. Let us set strict limits for the remainder of the season.
TEXT.Spanish: Verily, we must be wise stewards of the sea. Let us set strict limits for the remainder of the season.

TEXT.English: Hurry up, men! We will be the first to discover the route to Asia.
TEXT.French: Dépêchez-vous ! Nous serons les premier à découvrir la route pour l'Asie.
TEXT.German: Auf geht's, Männer! Wir werden die Ersten sein, die den Weg nach Asien entdecken!
TEXT.Italian: Hurry up, men! We will be the first to discover the route to Asia.
TEXT.Spanish: Hurry up, men! We will be the first to discover the route to Asia.

TEXT.English: Gold and glory! We take both!
TEXT.French: Or et Gloire ! Nous prenons les deux !
TEXT.German: Gold und Ruhm! Wir nehmen beides!
TEXT.Italian: Gold and glory! We take both!
TEXT.Spanish: Gold and glory! We take both!

TEXT.English: We prefer honour and glory. Spread the word that we have discovered the western route to Asia!
TEXT.French: Nous préférons l'honneur et la gloire. Apprenez au monde que nous avons découverte la route occidentale vers l'Asie !
TEXT.German: Ruhm und Ehre sind uns Lohn genug!
TEXT.Italian: We prefer honor and glory. Spread the word that we have discovered the western route to Asia!
TEXT.Spanish: We prefer honor and glory. Spread the word that we have discovered the western route to Asia!

TEXT.English: That's bad news. We shall be prepared.
TEXT.French: Il y aura d'autres hivers. Stockez des fourrures jusqu'à la prochaine fois.
TEXT.German: Das sind schlimme Nachrichten. Möge Gott uns vor diesen Aufrührern verschonen.
TEXT.Italian: Those are bad news. We shall be prepared.
TEXT.Spanish: Those are bad news. We shall be prepared.

TEXT.English: I suppose we have no choice. The loss of a dozen merchant ships would come to far less than this!
TEXT.French: Je suppose que nous n'avons pas le choix ... la perte d'une douzaine de navires marchands reviendrait bien plus cher que ceci!
TEXT.German: Wir haben vermutlich keine andere Wahl. Der Verlust eines Dutzend Handelsschiffe würde uns noch viel teurer kommen.
TEXT.Italian: I suppose we have no choice. The loss of a dozen merchant ships would come to far less than this!
TEXT.Spanish: I suppose we have no choice. The loss of a dozen merchant ships would come to far less than this!

TEXT.English: I will never knuckle under to these blackguards! Let them taste our steel and cannons!
TEXT.French: Je ne plierais jamais le genoux devant ces bandits! Faisons leur goûter notre acier et nos canons!
TEXT.German: Wir beugen uns nicht vor Banditen! Lasst sie unseren Stahl und unsere Kanonen schmecken!
TEXT.Italian: I will never knuckle under to these blackguards! Let them taste our steel and cannons!
TEXT.Spanish: I will never knuckle under to these blackguards! Let them taste our steel and cannons!

TEXT.English: Have you heard what he does to his prisoners? We must hand over the gold at once and count ourselves lucky.
TEXT.French: Avez vous déjà entendu ce qu'il fait à ces prisonniers? Nous devons payer l'or maintenant et nous considérez comme chanceux.
TEXT.German: Habt ihr die Gerüchte gehört, was er seinen Gefangen antuen soll ? Wir sollten sofort die Summe übergeben und uns glücklich schätzen.
TEXT.Italian: Have you heard what he does to his prisoners! We must hand over the gold at once and count ourselves lucky.
TEXT.Spanish: Have you heard what he does to his prisoners! We must hand over the gold at once and count ourselves lucky.

TEXT.English: A pox on you sir! You shall learn what this colony is made of!
TEXT.French: Soyez maudit monsieur! Vous allez apprendre de quel bois nous sommes faits dans cette colonie!
TEXT.German: Alle Flüche der See sollen ihn treffen! Wir greifen zu den Waffen!
TEXT.Italian: A pox on you sir! You shall learn what this colony is made of!
TEXT.Spanish: A pox on you sir! You shall learn what this colony is made of!

TEXT.English: They will not! Such talk is rubbish!
TEXT.French: Ils ne le feront pas ! Ces discussions n'ont pas de sens !
TEXT.German: Leeres Geschwätz. Diese treuen Seelen würden sich nie an meinem, also, ähäm, ich meine natürlich seiner Majestät Eigentum vergreifen. Hinfort! Beleidigt mein Ohr nicht mit solchen Lügenmärchen.
TEXT.Italian: They will not! Such Talking is rubbish!
TEXT.Spanish: They will not! Such Talking is rubbish!

TEXT.English: Take enough gold to pay more guards and be prepared!
TEXT.French: Prenez de l'or pour payer quelques gardes supplémentaires, et soyez prêts !
TEXT.German: Nun, das ist leider nur allzu wahr gesprochen. Nehmt etwas Gold und verstärkt die Wachmannschaften. Lasst uns hoffen, dass wir diese Quellen der Gier so rasch als möglich verschiffen können.
TEXT.Italian: Take some gold to pay more guards and be prepared!
TEXT.Spanish: Take some gold to pay more guards and be prepared!

TEXT.English: Get every adventurer on a horse and run them out of town. Let them find their own gold somewhere far, far away ...
TEXT.French: Allez chercher tous les aventuriers sur un cheval et sortez les des villes. Qu'ils cherchent leur propre or loin, très loin d'ici ...
TEXT.German: Trommelt die Leute zusammen! Lasst auf jedem Markte verkünden, dass der Reichtum des Landes unermesslich sei und jeder, der mit Lust und Wille in seine Tiefen vorstöße, das Gold mit bloßen Händen aufklauben könne! Vor allem fern unserer Häuser und Kirchen liegt das irdische Glück, weit, weit hinter den Hügeln. Gebt darauf jedem Halsabschneider, dem die Gier zu Kopfe gestiegen ist, ein Pferd und lasst ihn nicht aus den Augen, bis er hinter den Hügeln ist. Dann sollte wieder Ruhe einkehren.
TEXT.Italian: So get every venturer on a horse and right out of town. They may found their own gold somewhere far, far away ...
TEXT.Spanish: So get every venturer on a horse and right out of town. They may found their own gold somewhere far, far away ...

TEXT.English: So they want my gold? Well, force some of those volunteering scum to join the pirates. Of course, we´ve never talked about this, right?
TEXT.French: Ils veulent mon or ? Et bien dans ce cas forcez ces brigands à rejoindre nos pirates. Bien sûr, nous n'avons jamais parlé de cela, nous sommes bien d'accord ?
TEXT.German: Ei, da hat sich unter meine braven Kolonisten doch nicht der Abschaum der Gosse gemischt? Wohlan, lasst die Türen unverschlossen, streut weiter in den Kneipen, wo es etwas zu holen gibt. Ja, und wenn das Pack seine Beute versaufet und verspielet, dann legt sie in Ketten und bringt sie heimlich auf den alten Kahn im Hafen. Dort dürfen sie dann wählen, ob sie ihre Schuld Prise für Prise abzahlen oder mit Peitsche und Pranger abbluten wollen.
TEXT.Italian: So they want my gold? Well, force some of those volunteering scum to join the pirats, and of course, we´ve never talked about this, right?
TEXT.Spanish: So they want my gold? Well, force some of those volunteering scum to join the pirats, and of course, we´ve never talked about this, right?

TEXT.English: An old ship sets sail ...
TEXT.French: Un vieux navire hisse les voiles ...
TEXT.German: Ein alter Kahn sticht im Schatten der Unruhe unter Kapitän Jakob Spatz in See ...
TEXT.Italian: An old ship sets sail ...
TEXT.Spanish: An old ship sets sail ...

TEXT.English: For the sake of variety we need a well-educated man in our colonies. We will not remain a colony of workers and farmers. Issue the bill of exchange!
TEXT.French: For the sake of variety we need a well educated man in our colonies. We will not remain a colony of workers and farmers. Issue the bill of exchange!
TEXT.German: Wir könnten zur Abwechslung mal einen Akademiker brauchen. Wir wollen ja nicht eine Kolonie von Arbeitern und Bauern bleiben. Stellt ihm den Wechsel aus!
TEXT.Italian: For the sake of variety we need a well educated man in our colonies. We will not remain a colony of workers and farmers. Issue the bill of exchange!
TEXT.Spanish: For the sake of variety we need a well educated man in our colonies. We will not remain a colony of workers and farmers. Issue the bill of exchange!

TEXT.English: To be honest, we don't need another dandy who wastes our time and money. To establish this colony we need people who can tackle the challenges of the life here in the New World.
TEXT.French: To be honest, we don't need another dandy who wastes our time and money. To establish this colony we need people who can tackle the challanges of the life here in the New World.
TEXT.German: Lieber nicht, wir sind gerade etwas knapp bei Kasse und diese Studierten sind doch alles Aufschneider, die nur den ganzen Tag im Salon verbringen und kluge Reden schwingen. Ich brauche Leute, die auch anpacken können.
TEXT.Italian: To be honest, we don't need another dandy who wastes our time and money. To establish this colony we need people who can tackle the challanges of the life here in the New World.
TEXT.Spanish: To be honest, we don't need another dandy who wastes our time and money. To establish this colony we need people who can tackle the challanges of the life here in the New World.

TEXT.English: Well then, print some passages from the Bible. We shall further spread the words of Jesus Christ and the Apostles.
TEXT.French: Très bien, dans ce cas nous pourrions imprimer des passages de la Bible. Nous devons propager encore davantage la parole du Christ et de ses apôtres.
TEXT.German: Dann druckt Passage aus der Bibel. Wir werden die Worte Jesus Christi und der Apostel verbreiten.
TEXT.Italian: Well then, print some passages from the Bible. We shall further spread the words of Jesus Christ and the Apostles.
TEXT.Spanish: Well then, print some passages from the Bible. We shall further spread the words of Jesus Christ and the Apostles.

TEXT.English: We could print some interesting colonial news. Maybe an entertaining story from time to time.
TEXT.French: Nous pourrions imprimer les nouvelles truculantes de nos colonies. Des histoires plus légères et divertissantes.
TEXT.German: Wir könnten Nachrichten aus den Kolonien drucken. Vielleicht auch eine unterhaltsame Geschichte von Zeit zu Zeit.
TEXT.Italian: We could print some interesting colonial news. Maybe an entertaining story from time to time.
TEXT.Spanish: We could print some interesting colonial news. Maybe an entertaining story from time to time.

TEXT.English: I agree, these rough fellows have been very useful in the past. But now their success has made them arrogant. They've started attacks on our own merchant vessels. We will revoke their letters of marque and pay them out.
TEXT.French: I agree, these rough fellows have been very usefull in the past. But now their success made them arrogant. They have started attacks on our own merchant vessels. We will revoke their letters of marque and pay them out.
TEXT.German: Ich stimme zu. Bisher waren diese rauen Gesellen ganz nützlich. Aber ihre Erfolge haben sie überheblich gemacht. Mir liegen Berichte vor, dass vereinzelt sogar bereits unsere eigenen Handelsschiffe angegriffen wurden. Wir werden die Anzahl der ausgegebenen Kaperbriefe reduzieren und die Freibeuter ausbezahlen.
TEXT.Italian: I agree, these rough fellows have been very usefull in the past. But now their success made them arrogant. They have started attacks on our own merchant vessels. We will revoke their letters of marque and pay them out.
TEXT.Spanish: I agree, these rough fellows have been very usefull in the past. But now their success made them arrogant. They have started attacks on our own merchant vessels. We will revoke their letters of marque and pay them out.

TEXT.English: We can't do anything. These letters of marque have been issued by our own admiralty and the King. And the private investors will not willy-nilly waive their right to capture foreign merchant vessels.
TEXT.French: We can't do anything. These letters of marque have been issued by our own admiralty and the king. And the private investors will not willy-nilly waive their rights to capture foreign merchant vessels.
TEXT.German: Ja nun, dagegen können wir nichts machen. Die Kaperbriefe werden von der Admiralität auf Geheiß seiner Majestät ausgegeben. Und die privaten Eigner werden nicht gern auf ihre Profite verzichten wollen.
TEXT.Italian: We can't do anything. These letters of marque have been issued by our own admiralty and the king. And the private investors will not willy-nilly waive their rights to capture foreign merchant vessels.
TEXT.Spanish: We can't do anything. These letters of marque have been issued by our own admiralty and the king. And the private investors will not willy-nilly waive their rights to capture foreign merchant vessels.

TEXT.English: Great, our strategy takes effect! We won't stop it now. Furthermore we will issue more letters of marque to challenge them.
TEXT.French: Great, our strategy takes effect! We won't stop it now. Furthermore we will issue more letters of marque to challenge them.
TEXT.German: Ha, also zeigt die Strategie Wirkung! Wir werden vor diesen Bastarden nicht zu Kreuze kriechen. Wir werden weitere Kaperbriefe ausstellen, um deren Handel noch mehr zu schwächen.
TEXT.Italian: Great, our strategy takes effect! We won't stop it now. Furthermore we will issue more letters of marque to challenge them.
TEXT.Spanish: Great, our strategy takes effect! We won't stop it now. Furthermore we will issue more letters of marque to challenge them.

TEXT.English: Really good. This will reassure our neighbours and strengthen our trade.
TEXT.French: Really good. This will reassure our neighbours and strengthen our trade.
TEXT.German: Sehr gut, das wird unsere Nachbarn beruhigen und unseren Handel stärken.
TEXT.Italian: Really good. This will reassure our neighbours and strengthen our trade.
TEXT.Spanish: Really good. This will reassure our neighbours and strengthen our trade.

TEXT.English: That is a pity, but we cannot change it. However, they've done some profitable raids.
TEXT.French: This is a pitty, but we cannot change it. However, they did some profitable raids.
TEXT.German: Tja, leider nicht zu ändern. Wenigstens konnten sie einige profitable Kaperfahrten durchführen.
TEXT.Italian: This is a pitty, but we cannot change it. However, they did some profitable raids.
TEXT.Spanish: This is a pitty, but we cannot change it. However, they did some profitable raids.

TEXT.English: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners in exchange for a large share of the first year's profits.
TEXT.French: Vendez des actes de propriété aux mineurs les plus aisés en échange d'une large partie des profits de leur premier année.
TEXT.German: Verkauft Claimrechte an die wohlhabenderen unter ihnen und verlangt dafür einen Anteil am Profit des ersten Jahres.
TEXT.Italian: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners in exchange for a large share of the first year's profits.
TEXT.Spanish: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners in exchange for a large share of the first year's profits.

TEXT.English: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners, demanding all the money up front.
TEXT.French: Vendez des actes de propriété aux mineurs les plus aisés, demander tout l'argent à l'avance.
TEXT.German: Verkauft Claimrechte an die wohlhabenderen unter ihnen und verlangt dafür eine sofortige Vorausbezahlung.
TEXT.Italian: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners, demanding all the money up front.
TEXT.Spanish: Sell claim deeds to the more prosperous miners, demanding all the money up front.

TEXT.English: Pay to outfit them with the best equipment, as long as they agree to become our loyal subjects.
TEXT.French: Payer pour leur offrir le meilleur équipement, tant qu'ils acceptent de devenir nos fidèles sujets.
TEXT.German: Stattet sie mit bester Ausrüstung aus, wenn sie sich bereit erklären unsere loyalen Untertanen zu werden.
TEXT.Italian: Pay to outfit them with the finest equipment, as long as they agree to become our loyal subjects.
TEXT.Spanish: Pay to outfit them with the finest equipment, as long as they agree to become our loyal subjects.

TEXT.English: Run them out of town! This silver is mine alone!
TEXT.French: Chassez les de la ville ! L'argent est à moi et rien qu'à moi !
TEXT.German: Vertreibt sie aus der Stadt! Dieses Silber gehört uns alleine!
TEXT.Italian: Run them out of town! This silver is mine alone!
TEXT.Spanish: Run them out of town! This silver is mine alone!

TEXT.English: Oh well, if we allow the men some harmless relaxation, they will only work harder.
TEXT.French: Certes, mais si nous autorisons nos hommes à se relaxer, ça ne peut pas faire tant de mal et ils travailleront mieux.
TEXT.German: Ach was solls. Wenn wir den Männern etwas Entspannung gönnen, werden sie nur härter arbeiten.
TEXT.Italian: Oh well, if we allow the men some harmless relaxation, they will only work harder.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh well, if we allow the men some harmless relaxation, they will only work harder.

TEXT.English: Prostitutes in our city ? Chase those filthy women away.
TEXT.French: Des prostitués dans nos villes ? Chassez cette perversion immédiatement !
TEXT.German: Prostituierte in unserer Stadt ? Jagdt diese dreckigen Weibsbilder sofort weg.
TEXT.Italian: Prostitutes in our city ? Chase those filthy women away.
TEXT.Spanish: Prostitutes in our city ? Chase those filthy women away.

TEXT.English: That is a good offer. We will pay the Natives their price.
TEXT.French: C'est une bonne offre. Nous paierons le prix proposé.
TEXT.German: Das ist ein sehr gutes Angebot. Wir werden den Preis der Wilden zahlen.
TEXT.Italian: That is a good offer. We will pay the Natives their price.
TEXT.Spanish: That is a good offer. We will pay the Natives their price.

TEXT.English: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.French: Nous ne pouvons pas nous permettre cet investissement pour le moment.
TEXT.German: Wir haben das Geld für diese Investition leider nicht.
TEXT.Italian: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.Spanish: We currently cannot afford such an investment.

TEXT.English: We will hand this man over to the authorities in Europe.
TEXT.French: Nous allons extrader cette homme pour le rendre aux autorités qui le demandent en Europe.
TEXT.German: Wir werden diesen Mann der Authorität in Europa überstellen.
TEXT.Italian: We will hand over this man to the authorities in Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: We will hand over this man to the authorities in Europe.

TEXT.English: Your wish is our command, sire. May every iceberg be claimed in your honour!
TEXT.French: Votre souhait est de vous servir, Votre Majesté. Que chaque iceberg soit revendiqué en votre honneur !
TEXT.German: Euer Wunsch ist unser Befehl. Möge jeder Eisberg im Namen seiner Majestät bezwungen werden!
TEXT.Italian: Your wish is our command, sire. May every iceberg be claimed in your honour!
TEXT.Spanish: Your wish is our command, sire. May every iceberg be claimed in your honour!

TEXT.English: Alas, I regret to inform you that our humble industries don't have the capacity to meet this demand.
TEXT.French: Malheureusement, je suis aux regrets de vous informer que notre modeste industrie n'est pas en mesure de répondre à une telle demande.
TEXT.German: Leider ist es unserer bescheidenen Wirtschaft nicht möglich dieser Anfrage gerecht zu werden.
TEXT.Italian: Alas, I regret to inform you that our humble industries have not the capacity to meet this demand.
TEXT.Spanish: Alas, I regret to inform you that our humble industries have not the capacity to meet this demand.

TEXT.English: Consider it done, sir! Our doughty lumberjacks will set to work straight away.
TEXT.French: Considérer la tâche accomplie ! Nos valeureux bûcherons se mettent au travail dès maintenant.
TEXT.German: Betrachtet es als erledigt! Unsere Holzfäller werden sich sofort an die Arbeit machen.
TEXT.Italian: Consider it done sir! Our doughty lumberjacks will set to work straight away.
TEXT.Spanish: Consider it done sir! Our doughty lumberjacks will set to work straight away.

TEXT.English: Send our most experienced scouts! Wealth and glory awaits them, if they make a valuable discovery. And believe me, they better not come back without one!
TEXT.French: Envoyez nos éclaireurs les plus expérimentés ! Richesse et gloire les attendent, s'ils font une découverte de valeur. Et croyez-moi, ils n'ont pas intérêt à revenir sans !
TEXT.German: Schickt unsere erfahrensten Späher! Reichtum und Ehre erwartet die Männer, wenn sie wertvolle Entdeckungen machen. Und glaubt mir, sie sollten besser nicht ohne eine Entdeckung zurückkommen!
TEXT.Italian: Send our most experienced scouts! Wealth and glory awaits them, if they make a valuable discovery. And believe me, they better not come back without a discovery!
TEXT.Spanish: Send our most experienced scouts! Wealth and glory awaits them, if they make a valuable discovery. And believe me, they better not come back without a discovery!

TEXT.English: Researchers at the Royal Court expect more information about the savages in our region. Let the men search for the legacy of the natives.
TEXT.French: Des chercheurs de la cour du Roi souhaitent en savoir davantager sur les sauvages de notre région. Demandons à nos hommes de chercher à propos de l'héritage de nos indigènes.
TEXT.German: Bei Hofe erwartet man sich weitere Erkenntnisse über die Wilden. Lasst nach ihren Hinterlassenschaften suchen! Insbesondere die geheimnisvolle Knotenschrift hat es unseren Forschern angetan.
TEXT.Italian: Researchers at the royal court expect more information about the savages in our region. Let the men search for the legacy of the natives.
TEXT.Spanish: Researchers at the royal court expect more information about the savages in our region. Let the men search for the legacy of the natives.

TEXT.English: Let them search the junk and see if they can get something useful.
TEXT.French: Qu'ils cherchent dans le bazar pour voir s'ils y trouvent quelque chose d'utile.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie die Schrotthaufen nach etwas Verwertbarem durchsuchen.
TEXT.Italian: Let them search the junk and see if they can get something useful.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them search the junk and see if they can get something useful.

TEXT.English: My palace needs renovation. Let them search for treasures!
TEXT.French: Mon palais a besoin d'une petite restauration. Qu'ils recherchent un trésor !
TEXT.German: Mein Palast müsste dringend renoviert werden. Lasst sie nach Schätzen suchen!
TEXT.Italian: My palace needs renovation. Let them search for treasures!
TEXT.Spanish: My palace needs renovation. Let them search for treasures!

TEXT.English: A successful %s1_civ_adjective expedition returns from the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.French: Une expédition %s1_civ_adjective revient avec succès des ruines situées près de %s2_city.
TEXT.German: Die %s1:3_civ_adjective Expedition kehrt erfolgreich aus den Ruinen nahe %s2_city zurück!
TEXT.Italian: A successful %s1_civ_adjective expedition returns from the ruins near %s2_city.
TEXT.Spanish: A successful %s1_civ_adjective expedition returns from the ruins near %s2_city.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_RUINS_DONE_4
TXT_KEY_EVENT_RUINS_DONE_4
Shiver me timbers! It's been a long time since I last saw such rum blossoms! Let them keep the rum, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway.
TEXT.French: Sacre bleu ! Cela faisant longtemps que je n'avais pas vu autant de rhum disparaître ! Qu'ils gardent le rhum, le niveau d'alcoolisme dans notre colonie m'inquiétait déjà de toute façon.
TEXT.German: Potzblitz! Solche Schnapsnasen sind mir lange nicht mehr untergekommen. Lasst ihnen den Rum, es wurde sowieso Zeit gegen die Trunkenheit in unserer Kolonie vorzugehen.
TEXT.Italian: Shiver me timbers! It's been a long time since I last saw such rum blossoms! Let them keep the rum, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway.
TEXT.Spanish: Shiver me timbers! It's been a long time since I last saw such rum blossoms! Let them keep the rum, the drunkenness in our colony was worrying me anyway.

TEXT.English: Our dockers and sailors will mutiny if they are running low on rum. Stop them! Take up your arms!
TEXT.French: Nos dockers et marins vont se mutiner s'ils n'auront pas leur rhum. Arrêtons les ! A vos armes !
TEXT.German: Die Werftarbeiter und Matrosen werden meutern, wenn der Schnaps ausgeht. Haltet sie auf! Zu den Waffen, Männer!
TEXT.Italian: Our dockers and sailors will mutiny if they are running out or rum. Stop them! Take up your arms!
TEXT.Spanish: Our dockers and sailors will mutiny if they are running out or rum. Stop them! Take up your arms!

TEXT.English: Only the rum was looted? Nobody was hurt? Send them more rum, only good will come of that.
TEXT.French: Seulement le rhum a été pillé ? Personne n'a été blessé ? Envoyez leur plus de rhum, cela ne peut que nous apporter de bonnes choses.
TEXT.German: Sie haben nur den Rum gestohlen? Niemand wurde verletzt? Schickt ihnen noch eine zusätzliche Ladung, das wird sich noch für uns auszahlen.
TEXT.Italian: Only the rum was looted? Nobody was hurt? Send them more rum, only good will come of that.
TEXT.Spanish: Only the rum was looted? Nobody was hurt? Send them more rum, only good will come of that.

TEXT.English: Our %s1_civ neighbours show their appreciation for the rum delivery.
TEXT.French: Nos voisins %s1_civ apprécient la livraison de rhum.
TEXT.German: Unsere %s1_civ Nachbarn zeigen sich erkenntlich für den Rum.
TEXT.Italian: Our %s1_civ neighbours show their appreciation for the rum delivery.
TEXT.Spanish: Our %s1_civ neighbours show their appreciation for the rum delivery.

TEXT.English: We have no proof. Let our Indian neighbours keep the horses and get me new horses at once!
TEXT.French: Nous n'avons pas de preuve. Laissons nos voisins indiens garder les chevaux et trouvez en moi des nouveaux !
TEXT.German: Wir haben keine Beweise für diese Behauptung. Lasst unseren indianischen Nachbarn die Pferde und besorgt mir umgehend neue!
TEXT.Italian: We have no proof. Let our Indian neighbours keep the horses and get mes new horses at once!
TEXT.Spanish: We have no proof. Let our Indian neighbours keep the horses and get mes new horses at once!

TEXT.English: If they do not return our horses right now, this means war! Take up your arms!
TEXT.French: S'ils ne nous rapportent pas nos chevaux maintenant, cela signifiera la guerre ! A vous armes !
TEXT.German: Wenn sie unsere Pferde nicht freiwillig herausgeben, bedeutet das Krieg! Zu den Waffen, Männer!
TEXT.Italian: If they do not cough up our horses right now, this means war! Take up your arms!
TEXT.Spanish: If they do not cough up our horses right now, this means war! Take up your arms!

TEXT.English: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.French: Nous ne pouvons pas nous permettre un tel investissement pour le moment.
TEXT.German: Wir haben das Geld für diese Investition leider nicht.
TEXT.Italian: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.Spanish: We currently cannot afford such an investment.

TEXT.English: Send the mining expedition. Hopefully they will find something.
TEXT.French: Envoyez l'expédition minière et espérons qu'ils trouvent quelque chose.
TEXT.German: Schickt die Minenexpedition auf die Suche.
TEXT.Italian: Send the mining expedition. Hopefully they will find something.
TEXT.Spanish: Send the mining expedition. Hopefully they will find something.

TEXT.English: We would like to respectfully thank His Majesty and we appreciate His support. May we most humbly state that we are in dire need of resources to build up our colonies?
TEXT.French: Nous tenons à remercier respectueusement Sa Majesté et nous apprécions son soutien. Pouvons-nous faire état que nos colonies manquent cruellement de ressources pour leur construction ?
TEXT.German: Wir danken Euer Hoheit und nehmen die wohlfeile Hilfe gerne an. Wenn wir demütigst einen Wunsch äußern dürften - Rohstoffe für den Aufbau unserer Kolonie kämen uns sehr gelegen.
TEXT.Italian: We would like to respectfully thank His Majesty and we appreciate His support. May we most humbly state that we are in dear need of resources to build up our colonies?
TEXT.Spanish: We would like to respectfully thank His Majesty and we appreciate His support. May we most humbly state that we are in dear need of resources to build up our colonies?

TEXT.English: Your Majesty, if I may reconsider... The protection of our colony against wild animals and native raiders is even more important.
TEXT.French: Votre Majesté, sauf votre respect, la protection de notre colonie contre les dangers environnants, animaux sauvages et raids indigènes, est encore plus prioritaire.
TEXT.German: Majestät, wichtiger noch als der Aufbau unserer Kolonie ist ihr Schutz vor den Gefahren der Wildnis. Bestien und Eingeborene lauern uns allerorten auf.
TEXT.Italian: Your Majesty, if I may reconsider... The protection of our colony against wild animals and native raiders is even more important.
TEXT.Spanish: Your Majesty, if I may reconsider... The protection of our colony against wild animals and native raiders is even more important.

TEXT.English: If he is undisciplined, we cannot have him join the troops. But we could give him a chance as a scout.
TEXT.French: S'il est indiscipliné, nous ne pouvons lui permettre de rejoindre nos troupes. Il peut cependant devenir un éclaireur.
TEXT.German: Wenn er so undiszipliniert ist, kann er nicht bei der Truppe dienen. Er soll es aber als Scout versuchen.
TEXT.Italian: If he is undisciplined, we cannot have him join the troops. But we could give him a chance as a scout.
TEXT.Spanish: If he is undisciplined, we cannot have him join the troops. But we could give him a chance as a scout.

TEXT.English: Give him some tools. He shall work with the pioneers. We hope that we won't regret this.
TEXT.French: Donnez lui des outils. Il doit travailler en tant que pionnier. Nous espérons ne pas regretter cela.
TEXT.German: Gebt ihm Schaufel und Spitzhacke. Er kann bei den Pionieren anfangen. Hoffentlich werden wir dies nicht bereuen.
TEXT.Italian: Give him some tools. He shall work with the pioneers. We hope that we won't regret this.
TEXT.Spanish: Give him some tools. He shall work with the pioneers. We hope that we won't regret this.

TEXT.English: We are sorry, but he has been sentenced by law.
TEXT.French: Nous sommes désolé, mais il a été condamné par la loi.
TEXT.German: Er wurde rechtens verurteilt. Daran kann nichts geändert werden.
TEXT.Italian: We are sorry, but he has been sentenced by law.
TEXT.Spanish: We are sorry, but he has been sentenced by law.

TEXT.English: As they wish.. perhaps this will help us to curry favour at Court.
TEXT.French: Si tel est leur bon vouloir... Cela améliorera peut-être nos relations avec le Roi.
TEXT.German: Wir werden dem Wunsch folgen. Vielleicht bringt uns das ja auch einen Gefallen bei Hofe ein.
TEXT.Italian: As they wish.. perhaps this will help us to curry favour at Court.
TEXT.Spanish: As they wish.. perhaps this will help us to curry favour at Court.

TEXT.English: These people are human beings, not a museum exhibit!
TEXT.French: Ces indiens sont des êtres humains. Ils ne sont pas des monstres de foire!
TEXT.German: Wir sprechen hier von Menschen und nicht von Ausstellungsstücken!
TEXT.Italian: These people are human beings, not a museum exhibit!
TEXT.Spanish: These people are human beings, not a museum exhibit!

TEXT.English: Leave the harlots alone. They satisfy our workers. That might make them more productive.
TEXT.French: Laissez donc ces prostitués tranquille. Elles satisfont nos travailleurs bien solitaires. Peut-être qu'ils deviendront plus productifs.
TEXT.German: Lasst die Freudenmädchen in Ruhe! Den Männern wird's die Laune heben, und fröhlich und frisch arbeitet's am besten.
TEXT.Italian: Leave the harlots alone. They satisfy our workers. Maybe it will make them more productive.
TEXT.Spanish: Leave the harlots alone. They satisfy our workers. Maybe it will make them more productive.

TEXT.English: Seize these whores and send them to work on the fields! If they want to get brawny hands, they'll get them by honourable work.
TEXT.French: Attrapez-moi ces putes et envoyez-les aux champs ! Si elles veulent travailler, qu'elles le fassent dignement !
TEXT.German: Sammelt die Huren ein und schickt sie zur Arbeit auf die Felder! Wenn sie schwielige Hände bekommen wollen, dann durch anständige Arbeit.
TEXT.Italian: Gather these hookers and send them to work on the fields! If they want to get brawny hands, they'll get them by honourable work.
TEXT.Spanish: Gather these hookers and send them to work on the fields! If they want to get brawny hands, they'll get them by honourable work.

TEXT.English: These harlots surely have nimble fingers. Set each one of them in front of a loom!
TEXT.French: Si les marins sont satisfaits, ces prostituées doivent avoir les doigts agiles. Mettez-les donc devant un métier à tisser!
TEXT.German: Diese Dirnen haben doch sicher geschickte Finger. Setzt sie an den Webstuhl, da können sie sich nützlicher machen. Und schickt mir hin und wieder eine mit einer Arbeitsprobe vorbei.
TEXT.Italian: These harlots surely have nimble fingers. Get each one of them in front of a loom!
TEXT.Spanish: These harlots surely have nimble fingers. Get each one of them in front of a loom!

TEXT.English: What a pity! These poor young souls! Free them from the brothel and put them into Sunday school.
TEXT.French: Quelle honte ! Que Dieu sauve l'âme de ces filles perdues ! Libérez-les de ce lieu de débauche et envoyez-les à l'école du dimanche.
TEXT.German: Welch trauriges Los diese jungen Seelen doch haben! Befreit die Mädchen aus dem Bordell und steckt sie in die Sonntagsschule.
TEXT.Italian: What a pity! These poor young souls! Free them from the brothel and put them into Sunday school.
TEXT.Spanish: What a pity! These poor young souls! Free them from the brothel and put them into Sunday school.

TEXT.English: Enchain these sinners and send them back to Europe! And proclaim that our community here only accepts new members with true Christian faith!
TEXT.French: Enchainez ces pêcheresses et renvoyez-les en Europe ! Nous proclamons que notre communauté n'acceptent comme nouveaux membres que des chrétiens fidèles !
TEXT.German: Legt diese sündigen Metzen in Ketten und schickt sie mit dem nächsten Handelssegler zurück in die Heimat. Und lasst dort verkünden, dass unsere Gemeinschaft hier nur Menschen mit tugendhaftem christlichen Gebaren aufnimmt.
TEXT.Italian: Enchain these sinners and send them back to Europe! And proclaim that our community here only accepts new members with true Christian faith!
TEXT.Spanish: Enchain these sinners and send them back to Europe! And proclaim that our community here only accepts new members with true Christian faith!

TEXT.English: These poors souls shall be welcomed. Give them something to eat so they can recover their strength.
TEXT.French: Ces pauvres âmes doivent être accueillis. Donnez leur une bonne couverture et de quoi manger pour qu'ils retrouvent leur force.
TEXT.German: Diese armen Seelen sind uns wie alle anderen Willkommen. Gebt ihnen etwas zu Essen, damit sie wieder zu Kräften kommen.
TEXT.Italian: These poors souls shall be welcomed. Give them something to eat so they can recover their strength.
TEXT.Spanish: These poors souls shall be welcomed. Give them something to eat so they can recover their strength.

TEXT.English: Send them away. We cannot risk disease spreading in our colonies.
TEXT.French: Renvoyez les. Nous ne pouvons pas prendre le risque de propager des maladies dans nos colonies.
TEXT.German: Schickt sie fort. Es muss verhindert werden, dass sich eine Krankheit oder gar eine Seuche in den Kolonien ausbreitet.
TEXT.Italian: Send them away. We cannot risk diseases spreading in our colonies.
TEXT.Spanish: Send them away. We cannot risk diseases spreading in our colonies.

TEXT.English: Confiscate the ship and hand over these criminals to the officials in Europe.
TEXT.French: Confisquez le navire et renvoyez les criminels pour qu'ils soient jugés en Europe.
TEXT.German: Konfisziert das Schiff und übergebt diese Gauner den Behörden in Europa.
TEXT.Italian: Confiscate the ship and hand over these criminals to the officials in Europe.
TEXT.Spanish: Confiscate the ship and hand over these criminals to the officials in Europe.

TEXT.English: Offer them a deal. As long as they regularly give us a small share of the salt they buy, they shall not be bothered any more.
TEXT.French: Proposez leur un marché. Tant qu'ils nous offrent une partie du sel qu'ils achètent, ils n'auront pas d'ennuis.
TEXT.German: Bietet ihnen einen Handel an. Solange sie uns regelmässig einen kleinen Teil des Salzes geben, welches sie erwerben, sollen sie von uns unbehelligt bleiben.
TEXT.Italian: Offer them a deal. As long as they regularly give us a small share of the salt they buy, they shall not be bothered anymore.
TEXT.Spanish: Offer them a deal. As long as they regularly give us a small share of the salt they buy, they shall not be bothered anymore.

TEXT.English: That sounds like bad news, but what can we do? Nothing.
TEXT.French: Ce sont des mauvaises nouvelles, mais qu'y faire ? Rien.
TEXT.German: Traurig, nicht? Die Hungernden haben mein Mitgefühl.
TEXT.Italian: Sembrano brutte notizie, ma cosa ci possiamo fare? Niente.
TEXT.Spanish: Son malas noticias, pero ¿qué podemos hacer? Nada.

TEXT.English: Pay to have the lost grain replaced.
TEXT.French: Payer pour remplacer le grain perdu.
TEXT.German: Eine furchtbare Sache! Nehmt etwas Gold und rüstet eine Wagenfuhre aus, ihnen Korn und Linsen zu bringen.
TEXT.Italian: Paga affinché il grano perduto sia sostituito.
TEXT.Spanish: Que se pague la reposición de los cereales perdidos.

TEXT.English: Sail as fast as you can!
TEXT.French: Naviguons aussi vite que possible !
TEXT.German: Nutzt die Gelegenheit und segelt, was das Zeug hält!
TEXT.Italian: Sail as fast as you can!
TEXT.Spanish: Sail as fast as you can!

TEXT.English: The Chapel is the only reasonable choice for the children of Christ.
TEXT.French: Il n'y a d'autres choix raisonnable que celui de la chapelle pour les enfants du Christ.
TEXT.German: Die Kapelle ist die einzige sinnvolle Wahl für die Kinder Christi.
TEXT.Italian: The Chapel is the only reasonable choice for the children of Christ.
TEXT.Spanish: The Chapel is the only reasonable choice for the children of Christ.

TEXT.English: The Tavern is more important because it will help to bring the citizens closer together.
TEXT.French: La taverne permettra de rassembler les citoyens ensemble. Il s'agit du choix le plus sensé.
TEXT.German: Die Taverne ist wichtiger, da sie helfen wird, die Gemeinde näher zusammen zu bringen.
TEXT.Italian: The Tavern is more important because it will help to bring the citizens closer together.
TEXT.Spanish: The Tavern is more important because it will help to bring the citizens closer together.

TEXT.English: To avoid any arguments, the Materials shall be confiscated and sold.
TEXT.French: Pour éviter tout argument, les matériaux seront confisqués et vendus. Qu'on ne me dérange plus pour ces enfantillages !
TEXT.German: Um Streit zu verhindern, sollen die Materialien einfach verkauft werden.
TEXT.Italian: To avoid any arguments, the Materials shall be confiscated and sold.
TEXT.Spanish: To avoid any arguments, the Materials shall be confiscated and sold.

TEXT.English: Well then, the early bird catches the worm. Let our settlers pack their belongings and send them into the wilderness.
TEXT.French: Eh bien, l'oiseau doit bien finir par attraper le ver. Laissons nos colons faire leurs bagages et envoyons-les dans l'arrière-pays.
TEXT.German: Nun denn, der frühe Vogel fängt den Wurm. Lasst unsere Siedler ihre Habseligkeiten packen und scheucht sie in die Wildnis!
TEXT.Italian: Well then, the early bird catches the worm. Let our settlers pack their belongings and send them into the wilderness.
TEXT.Spanish: Well then, the early bird catches the worm. Let our settlers pack their belongings and send them into the wilderness.

TEXT.English: These pioneers came just in time to cultivate the land for us.
TEXT.French: Ces pionniers arrivent juste à temps pour cultiver les terres pour nous.
TEXT.German: Diese Pioniere kommen gerade recht, um das Umland der neuen Siedlungen urbar zu machen!
TEXT.Italian: These pioneers came just in time to cultivate the land for us.
TEXT.Spanish: These pioneers came just in time to cultivate the land for us.

TEXT.English: Let the world know that we made meaningful discoveries.
TEXT.French: Apprenons au monde que nous avons fait des découvertes significatives.
TEXT.German: Lasst unsere Entdeckungen in aller Welt verkünden und unseren Ruhm mehren.
TEXT.Italian: Let the world know that we made meaningful discoveries.
TEXT.Spanish: Let the world know that we made meaningful discoveries.

TEXT.English: That sounds like a wonderful idea. They shall take the food from storage and can also have some gold from our treasury.
TEXT.French: Cela semble être une merveilleuse idée. Ils peuvent se servir en nourriture dans leur réserve et recevront de l'Or de notre trésorerie.
TEXT.German: Natürlich werden wir diese hervorragende Idee unterstützen. Sie sollen die Nahrung aus ihren Lagern nehmen und zusätzlich noch etwas Gold aus der Schatzkammer erhalten.
TEXT.Italian: That sounds like a wonderful idea. They shall take the food from their storage and will additionally receive some gold from our treasury.
TEXT.Spanish: That sounds like a wonderful idea. They shall take the food from their storage and will additionally receive some gold from our treasury.

TEXT.English: This is no time for festivities. Tell them to get to work again.
TEXT.French: Nous n'avons pas le temps pour des festivités. Demandez-leur de se remettre au travail.
TEXT.German: Für Feierlichkeiten ist keine Zeit. Richtet ihnen aus, dass sie wieder an ihre Arbeit sollen.
TEXT.Italian: There is no time for festivities. Tell them to get to work again.
TEXT.Spanish: There is no time for festivities. Tell them to get to work again.
