TEXT.English: Get me the head of this crowd and hoist some more flags of our king. A fair word between two gentleman and a glass of wine should sort things out. I'll make him an offer he can't refuse..
TEXT.French: Amenez moi le meneur de cette foule et hisser davantage de drapeau de notre roi. Un simple dialogue entre deux gentilshommes autour d'un verre de vin devrait clarifier les choses. Je vais lui faire une offre qu'il ne pourra refuser...
TEXT.German: Holt mir den führenden Kopf hierher und hängt noch zwei königliche Banner aus dem Fenster. Ein guter Schluck Wein und ein offenes Gespräch haben schon so manche Bluttat verhindert. Ich werde ihm ein Angebot machen, dass er nicht ablehnen kann.
TEXT.Italian: Get me the head of this crowd and hoist some more flags of our king. A fair word between two gentleman and a glass of wine should sort things out. I'll make him an offer he can't refuse.
TEXT.Spanish: Get me the head of this crowd and hoist some more flags of our king. A fair word between two gentleman and a glass of wine should sort things out. I'll make him an offer he can't refuse.

TEXT.English: They look like really fine lads! I want them to stand guard next to my bed from now on. That will ease my slumber.
TEXT.French: Ils sont vraiment beaux ! Je souhaite qu'il garde la chambre à partir de dorénavant. Cela va faliciter mon sommeil.
TEXT.German: Das sind wahrlich stramme Kerls, mein Leib und Leben scheint mir bei ihnen in guten Händen. Postiert sie zu beiden Seiten des Bettes, auf dass mein Schlummer friedlich bleiben möge.
TEXT.Italian: They look like really fine lads! I want them to stand guard next to my bed from now on, that will ease my slumber.
TEXT.Spanish: They look like really fine lads! I want them to stand guard next to my bed from now on, that will ease my slumber.

TEXT.English: Let them talk! Freedom of speech and conscience for every man, that is our watchword.
TEXT.French: Laissez le parler ! La liberté d'expression et de conscience appartient à chacun. C'est notre principe de vie.
TEXT.German: Lasst sie gewähren, der wache Geist und das freie Wort waren mir stets teuer. Ich unterdrücke sie nicht, sagt ihnen das. Sie sind hier mindestens so frei, ihre unverbrüchliche Königsliebe zu leben, wie in unserem Mutterland.
TEXT.Italian: Let them proceed! The freedom of speech has always been important to me. I won´t opress them, tell them so. They are free to live ther Loyalty here the same way as in the country of their ancestors.
TEXT.Spanish: Let them proceed! The freedom of speech has always been important to me. I won´t opress them, tell them so. They are free to live ther Loyalty here the same way as in the country of their ancestors.

TEXT.English: Don´t bother me again with these powdered fops! They give me a headache.
TEXT.French: Ne me déranger pas à nouveau avec fats en poudre ! Cela me donne mal à la tête.
TEXT.German: Davon kriege ich Kopfschmerzen, bitte, belästigt mich nicht weiter mit diesen gepuderten Affenhirnen.
TEXT.Italian: Don´t bother me again with these poudered howler monkeys, the give me headache.
TEXT.Spanish: Don´t bother me again with these poudered howler monkeys, the give me headache.

TEXT.English: Let our brave troops disperse them, but press them no further! I will not see blood spilled in our streets.
TEXT.French: Envoyez nos troupes pour disperser la foule, mais pas davantage ! Je ne veux pas de sang dans nos rues.
TEXT.German: Lasst die Truppen diesen Haufen auflösen, mit diesen Hitzköpfen lässt sich einfach nicht diskutieren ... Ich will aber kein Blutvergießen, also denkt daran, zur Not nutzt den Gewehrkolben, aber dass mir kein Schuss fällt!
TEXT.Italian: Let our brave troops stop that crowd, but just send them home! I don´t want any blood spilled in our streets.
TEXT.Spanish: Let our brave troops stop that crowd, but just send them home! I don´t want any blood spilled in our streets.

TEXT.English: A hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, that´s all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" gives me another idea..
TEXT.French: Quel plan démoniaque, ces chiens ! Très bien, sauvez ce que vous pouvez, c'est la seule chose que nous pouvons faire maintenant... mais cette drôle de « fête » m'a donné une idée...
TEXT.German: Ein teuflischer Plan, diese Hunde, rettet, was zu retten ist ... allein, der Wortlaut dieses Anschlages kommt mir wirklich bekannt vor.
TEXT.Italian: The hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, that´s all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" thing really remembers me of something.
TEXT.Spanish: The hell of a plan, these devils! Alright, save what you can, that´s all we can do for now ... but this kind of "party" thing really remembers me of something.

TEXT.English: Gun them down, disposses them, banish them! Better we get rid off this scum now, or else they'll stab us later in the back.
TEXT.French: J'ordonne aux soldats de tirer ! Vous devez les déposer et les bannir ! Il vaut mieux se débarasser d'eux maintenant plutôt qu'ils nous trahissent plus tard.
TEXT.German: Kartätscht dieses Pack zusammen, enteignet sie, jagt sie aus der Stadt! Besser wir bereinigen die Sache jetzt schnell und gründlich, als dass sie uns später in den Rücken fallen ...
TEXT.Italian: Gun them down, disposses them, banish them! Better we get rid off this scum now, as that it attacks us from behind later.
TEXT.Spanish: Gun them down, disposses them, banish them! Better we get rid off this scum now, as that it attacks us from behind later.

TEXT.English: Sheer perfidy! They´ve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... whatever his name is, I will find him!
TEXT.French: Quelle perfidie ! Ils sont allés trop loin ! Cherchez dans toute la ville, retournez la forêt, fouillez le désert ! Je vais trouver ce, ce... peu importe son nom je vais le trouver !
TEXT.German: WAS ZUM TEUFEL? Oh, diese Barbaren, durchsucht die Stadt, durchstöbert die Wälder, durchkämmt die Wüsten! Ich werde diesen, diesen ... na wie auch immer er heißt, kriegen!
TEXT.Italian: WHAT THE HELL? Oh, they´ve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... what ever his name is, but I will find him!
TEXT.Spanish: WHAT THE HELL? Oh, they´ve gone too far! Search the whole town, rummage through the forest, comb the desert! I will find this, this ... what ever his name is, but I will find him!

TEXT.English: Do what we can to aid the survivors.
TEXT.French: Faire notre possible pour aider les survivants.
TEXT.German: O ja! Natürlich helfen wir. Lasst uns die Notleidenden in unser Gebet einschließen. Am besten in ein Tischgebet! Nach solchen furchtbaren Nachrichten brauche ich immer einen Schnaps.
TEXT.Italian: Fa' quello che puoi per aiutare i sopravvissuti.
TEXT.Spanish: Haced cuanto podáis para ayudar a los supervivientes.

TEXT.English: Do what we can to aid the survivors.
TEXT.French: Faire notre possible pour aider les survivants.
TEXT.German: Da tut Hilfe not, keine Frage. Schickt einen Trupp los, die Unglücksstelle zu sichern, damit sie im Handumdrehen wieder aufgebaut werden kann.
TEXT.Italian: Fa' quello che puoi per aiutare i sopravvissuti.
TEXT.Spanish: Haced cuanto podáis para ayudar a los supervivientes.

TEXT.English: The trappers shall leave these forests right away. This land belongs to our Native friends.
TEXT.French: Les trappeurs doivent quitter la forêt immédiatement. Ces terres appartiennent effectivement aux indigènes.
TEXT.German: Die Trapper sollen diese Wälder sofort verlassen. Sie gehören unseren wilden Freunden.
TEXT.Italian: The trappers shall leave these forests right away. This land belongs to our Native friends.
TEXT.Spanish: The trappers shall leave these forests right away. This land belongs to our Native friends.

TEXT.English: We will buy those forests from our Native friends and hire the trappers to work for us.
TEXT.French: Nous allons acheter ces forêts à nos amis indigènes et engager les trappeurs pour qu'ils travaillent pour nous.
TEXT.German: Wir werden diese Wälder kaufen und die Trapper für uns arbeiten lassen.
TEXT.Italian: We will buy those forests from our Native friends and hire the trappers to work for us.
TEXT.Spanish: We will buy those forests from our Native friends and hire the trappers to work for us.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
Tell me more.
TEXT.French: Dites-m'en plus.
TEXT.German: Ich möchte mehr erfahren.
TEXT.Italian: Dimmi di più.
TEXT.Spanish: Explicadme más.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_CIVILOPEDIA
Please disable tutorial quests.
TEXT.French: Veuillez désactiver les quêtes du didacticiel.
TEXT.German: Bitte die Tutorial-Quests deaktivieren.
TEXT.Italian: Disattiva le imprese del tutorial.
TEXT.Spanish: Por favor, desactivad las misiones del tutorial.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
I will establish my colony in the New World.
TEXT.French: Je vais fonder ma colonie dans le Nouveau monde.
TEXT.German: Ich werde meine Kolonie in der Neuen Welt gründen.
TEXT.Italian: Insedierò la mia colonia nel Nuovo Mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: Fundaré mi colonia en el Nuevo Mundo.

TEXT.English: Return to game.
TEXT.French: Retour à la partie.
TEXT.German: Zum Spiel zurückkehren.
TEXT.Italian: Torna alla partita.
TEXT.Spanish: Regresar al juego.

TEXT.English: I will pick up the colonist from Europe.
TEXT.French: Je vais récupérer le colon en Europe.
TEXT.German: Ich werde den Kolonisten in Europa abholen.
TEXT.Italian: Prenderò il colono in Europa.
TEXT.Spanish: Recogeré al Colono de Europa.

TEXT.English: He can wait. I have other things to attend to.
TEXT.French: Il peut attendre. J'ai d'autres choses plus importantes à faire.
TEXT.German: Er kann warten. Ich muss mich um andere Dinge kümmern.
TEXT.Italian: Può aspettare. Ho altre cose da fare.
TEXT.Spanish: Que se espere. Tengo otras cosas que hacer.

TEXT.English: I will improve my land.
TEXT.French: Je vais améliorer mon territoire.
TEXT.German: Ich werde mein Land modernisieren.
TEXT.Italian: Migliorerò la terra.
TEXT.Spanish: Mejoraré mi tierra.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
I will join a unit to a settlement.
TEXT.French: Je vais intégrer une unité à une colonie.
TEXT.German: Ich schließe eine Einheit einer Siedlung an.
TEXT.Italian: Unirò un'unità a un insediamento.
TEXT.Spanish: Uniré una unidad al asentamiento.

TEXT.English: Back to the game.
TEXT.French: Retour à la partie.
TEXT.German: Zurück zum Spiel.
TEXT.Italian: Torna alla partita.
TEXT.Spanish: Volver al juego.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
I have no interest in improving my land right now.
TEXT.French: Je n'ai aucune envie d'améliorer mon territoire.
TEXT.German: Ich möchte im Augenblick mein Land nicht modernisieren.
TEXT.Italian: Non mi interessa migliorare la terra, in questo momento.
TEXT.Spanish: Ahora mismo no tengo interés en mejorar la tierra.

TEXT.English: I have no interest in improving my land right now.
TEXT.French: Je n'ai aucune envie d'améliorer mon territoire.
TEXT.German: Ich möchte im Augenblick mein Land nicht modernisieren.
TEXT.Italian: Non mi interessa migliorare la terra, in questo momento.
TEXT.Spanish: Ahora mismo no tengo interés en mejorar la tierra.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
I will make a Pioneer.
TEXT.French: Je vais créer un pionnier.
TEXT.German: Ich möchte einen Pionier errichten.
TEXT.Italian: Creerò un pioniere.
TEXT.Spanish: Haré un Pionero.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
I would rather explore this New World.
TEXT.French: Je vais plutôt explorer ce nouveau monde qui s'offre à moi.
TEXT.German: Ich möchte lieber diese neue Welt erforschen.
TEXT.Italian: Preferirei esplorare questo nuovo mondo.
TEXT.Spanish: Preferiría explorar este nuevo mundo.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
I will go speak to a Chief right away.
TEXT.French: Je vais de ce pas rencontrer un chef.
TEXT.German: Ich werde sofort mit einem Häuptling sprechen.
TEXT.Italian: Parlerò subito con un capo.
TEXT.Spanish: Iré a hablar con un jefe ahora mismo.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
I don't want to talk to the native chiefs.
TEXT.French: Je refuse d'aller à la rencontre des chefs indigènes.
TEXT.German: Ich will nicht mit den Eingeborenenhäuptlingen sprechen.
TEXT.Italian: Non voglio andare a parlare con i capi dei nativi.
TEXT.Spanish: No quiero hablar con los jefes nativos.

TEXT.English: TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
TXT_KEY_EVENT_TUTORIAL_RETURN_TO_GAME
Send what aid we can to the survivors. Be thankful that the city itself was not struck.
TEXT.French: Envoyer toute l'aide que nous pouvons aux survivants. Remercions le ciel que la ville ait été épargnée.
TEXT.German: Welch grausige Kunde! Die armen Seelen haben mein tiefes Mitgefühl. Doch kann ich helfen? Selbst der mächtigste Mann ist machtlos gegen die Gewalten von Himmel und Hölle.
TEXT.Italian: Invia gli aiuti disponibili ai sopravvissuti. Sii contento che la città non sia stata colpita.
TEXT.Spanish: Enviad cuanta ayuda podamos a los supervivientes. Demos gracias de que la propia ciudad no se haya visto afectada.

TEXT.English: Organize festivities to celebrate this fortunate turn of events.
TEXT.French: Organisons des festivités pour célébrer la nouvelle.
TEXT.German: Organisiert ein Fest, um diese glückliche Wendung des Schicksals zu feiern.
TEXT.Italian: Organizzate festivita per celebrare questa fortunata.
TEXT.Spanish: Organize festivities to celebrate this fortunate turn of events.

TEXT.English: We will have to send workers to repair them at a later time.
TEXT.French: Nous enverrons des travailleurs les réparer plus tard.
TEXT.German: Das ist bedauerlich. Aber von Bedeutung dünkt es mir nicht zu sein.
TEXT.Italian: Dovremo inviare i lavoratori per ripararle in un secondo momento.
TEXT.Spanish: Tendremos que enviar trabajadores a repararlas cuanto antes.

TEXT.English: Dispatch emergency crews to repair the damage, without heed to cost.
TEXT.French: Envoyer des équipes d'urgence réparer les dégâts, quel qu'en soit le coût.
TEXT.German: Baukolonnen sollen möglichst rasch den Schlamm wegschippen, auf dass die Straße wieder befahrbar ist.[NEWLINE]Rüstet die Männer großzügig mit Fleisch, Brot und geistigen Getränken aus, damit sie ihren Auftrag frohen Herzens angehen!
TEXT.Italian: Invia squadre di emergenza per riparare i danni, senza badare ai costi.
TEXT.Spanish: Que partan equipos de emergencia a arreglar los daños, sin reparar en gastos.

TEXT.English: "Well, as long as he can show me on a map where he ran his rotten ship into the whales, nothing at all. But, if not, I've got my sword right here."
TEXT.French: « Et bien, s'il est capable de me montrer la localisation de ce monstre sur une carte, rien du tout. Mais si ce n'est pas le cas, mon épée attend dans son fourreau. »
TEXT.German: "Besorgt mehr Rum! Solange er mir auf der Seekarte markieren kann, wo er seinen Seelenverkäufer in die Walherde gelenkt hat, solange soll er erzählen können, was er will. Sollte er sich aber nicht recht erinnern, nun, meinen Degen trage ich bei mir ..."
TEXT.Italian: "Well, as long as he can show me on a map, where he bumped his rotten ship into the whales . nothing at all. But if not, i got my small sword right here."
TEXT.Spanish: "Well, as long as he can show me on a map, where he bumped his rotten ship into the whales . nothing at all. But if not, i got my small sword right here."

TEXT.English: Actually we always wanted to do this, only it was never the right time. Give him the job!
TEXT.French: Actually we always wanted to do this, only the right time for doing this had never opened up. Give him the job!
TEXT.German: Perfekt, das wollten wir doch schon lange in Angriff nehmen. Stellt ihn ein!
TEXT.Italian: Actually we always wanted to do this, only the right time for doing this had never opened up. Give him the job!
TEXT.Spanish: Actually we always wanted to do this, only the right time for doing this had never opened up. Give him the job!

TEXT.English: Oh my god, what a stupid idea! The pirates cruising along our coasts are waiting for such fat prey! We don't have enough military vessels to protect our whaling ships and without protection this is a suicidal endeavour. We cannot employ him.
TEXT.French: Oh my god, what a stupid idea! The pirates cruising along our coasts are already waiting for such fat prey! We have not enough military vessels to protect our whaling ships and without procetion this is a rather senseless endeavor. We cannot employ him.
TEXT.German: Bei den vielen Piraten, die hier in dieser Gegend zur Zeit kreuzen? Wir haben nicht die Mittel, um alle unsere Walfänger von Kriegschiffen bewachen zu lassen. Und ohne Schutz ist das ein sinnloses Unterfangen. Wir können ihn derzeit nicht gebrauchen.
TEXT.Italian: Oh my god, what a stupid idea! The pirates cruising along our coasts are already waiting for such fat prey! We have not enough military vessels to protect our whaling ships and without procetion this is a rather senseless endeavor. We cannot employ him.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh my god, what a stupid idea! The pirates cruising along our coasts are already waiting for such fat prey! We have not enough military vessels to protect our whaling ships and without procetion this is a rather senseless endeavor. We cannot employ him.

TEXT.English: Agreed, the region and our purse will benefit from this deal. However, I assume that we will need to calm down our neighbours.
TEXT.French: Agreed, the region and our purse will benefit from this deal. However, I assume that we will need to calm down the reaction of our neighbours.
TEXT.German: Das kommt uns sehr gelegen, die Region und unsere Geldbörse werden davon sehr profitieren. Also einverstanden, setzen Sie die entsprechenden Verträge auf. Die Steuern setz ohnehin der König fest. Mit unseren Nachbarn werden wir uns schon arrangieren.
TEXT.Italian: Agreed, the region and our purse will benefit from this deal. However, I assume that we will need to calm down the reaction of our neighbours.
TEXT.Spanish: Agreed, the region and our purse will benefit from this deal. However, I assume that we will need to calm down the reaction of our neighbours.

TEXT.English: These poor animals. They need our protection but not our harpoons. Furthermore our neighbours are already whaling in this area. I will not jeopardise our relationship.
TEXT.French: These poor animals. They need our protection but not our harpoons. Furthermore our neighbours do already whaling in this area. I will not jeopardise our relationship.
TEXT.German: Diese armen Tiere. Sie benötigen unseren Schutz, nicht unsere Harpunen. Außerdem betreiben unsere Nachbarn hier bereits Walfang. Ich möchte die guten Beziehungen nicht gefährden.
TEXT.Italian: These poor animals. They need our protection but not our harpoons. Furthermore our neighbours do already whaling in this area. I will not jeopardise our relationship.
TEXT.Spanish: These poor animals. They need our protection but not our harpoons. Furthermore our neighbours do already whaling in this area. I will not jeopardise our relationship.

TEXT.English: Give them the weapons stored in the city. They shall form a militia and protect themselves.
TEXT.French: Donnez leur les armes stockés dans la ville. Ils doivent former une milice et se protéger par eux-mêmes.
TEXT.German: Gebt ihnen einige der gelagterten Waffen. Sie sollen eine Miliz aufstellen und sich selbst beschützen.
TEXT.Italian: Give them the weapons stored in the city. They shall form a militia and protect themselves.
TEXT.Spanish: Give them the weapons stored in the city. They shall form a militia and protect themselves.

TEXT.English: We will hire some hunters to take care of this wild animal.
TEXT.French: Nous allons engager des chasseurs pour qu'ils s'occupent de cet animal sauvage.
TEXT.German: Wir werden Jäger anheuern, die dieses Tier zur Strecke bringen werden.
TEXT.Italian: We will hire some hunters to take care of this wild animal.
TEXT.Spanish: We will hire some hunters to take care of this wild animal.

TEXT.English: It is just an animal. They need to stop whining like children.
TEXT.French: Ce n'est qu'un animal. Il n'y a pas besoin de larmoyer comme un enfant.
TEXT.German: Es handelt sich doch nur um ein Tier. Sie sollen endlich aufhören wie kleine Kinder zu weinen.
TEXT.Italian: It is just an animal. They need to stop whining like children.
TEXT.Spanish: It is just an animal. They need to stop whining like children.

TEXT.English: That is a good offer. We will pay the vintager's price.
TEXT.French: C'est une bonne offre. Nous paierons le prix proposé.
TEXT.German: Das ist ein sehr gutes Angebot. Wir werden den Preis des Winzers zahlen.
TEXT.Italian: That is a good offer. We will pay the vintager's price.
TEXT.Spanish: That is a good offer. We will pay the vintager's price.

TEXT.English: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.French: Nous ne pouvons pas nous permettre cet investissement pour le moment.
TEXT.German: Wir haben das Geld für diese Investition leider nicht.
TEXT.Italian: We currently cannot afford such an investment.
TEXT.Spanish: We currently cannot afford such an investment.

TEXT.English: Oh well, let them keep the wine. Nobody was hurt during this prank. Being hard on them would only upset the population.
TEXT.French: Et bien dans ce cas laissons les garder le vin. Personne n'a été blessée. Une punition trop stricte risque d'énerver la population.
TEXT.German: Lasst ihnen den Wein. Wegen eines Streichs einiger Jungendliche hart vorzugehen, würde nur für Unruhe sorgen.
TEXT.Italian: Oh well, let them keep the wine. Nobody was hurt during this prank. Going hard on them would only upset the population.
TEXT.Spanish: Oh well, let them keep the wine. Nobody was hurt during this prank. Going hard on them would only upset the population.

TEXT.English: This is not just a prank, this is theft! Send out our soldiers to capture those criminals. They shall be punished severely!
TEXT.French: Ce n'est pas qu'une farce, c'est un vol ! Envoyez nos soldats pour arrêter ces criminels. Ils doivent être punis sévèrement !
TEXT.German: Diesen Diebstahl kann man nicht als Streich einiger Jugendlicher durchgehen lassen. Schickt Männer aus um die Diebe zu fangen, damit sie hart bestraft werden.
TEXT.Italian: This is not just a prank, this is theft! Send out our soldiers to capture those criminals. They shall be punished severely!
TEXT.Spanish: This is not just a prank, this is theft! Send out our soldiers to capture those criminals. They shall be punished severely!

TEXT.English: Send as many furs and coats to Europe as we can spare.
TEXT.French: Envoyez autant de fourrures et de manteaux vers l'Europe que nous sommes en mesure d'offrir.
TEXT.German: Bitterkalte Winter in unserer europäischen Heimat lässt die Menschen frieren. Schickt soviele Pelzwaren und Felle nach Europa, wie wir entbehren können!
TEXT.Italian: Send as many furs and coats to Europe as we can spare.
TEXT.Spanish: Send as many furs and coats to Europe as we can spare.

TEXT.English: This is superstitious nonsense. Of course they are welcome in our community, birthmarks or not.
TEXT.French: Encore une superstition absurde. Bien sûr qu'elles sont acceptées dans la commune, tâche de naissance ou pas.
TEXT.German: Das ist abergläubischer Unsinn. Sie sind selbstverständlich in unserer Gemeinschaft willkommen.
TEXT.Italian: This is superstitious nonsense. Of course they are welcome in our community, birthmarks or not.
TEXT.Spanish: This is superstitious nonsense. Of course they are welcome in our community, birthmarks or not.

TEXT.English: A grave accusation that must be taken seriously! Impound them, and send for a learned expert from Europe to deliberate the matter.
TEXT.French: Une accusation aussi grave doit être prise sérieusement ! Gardez les à vue, et envoyez un expert d'Europe pour délibérer sur le sujet.
TEXT.German: Eine schwere Anschuldigung, die aber ernst genommen werden muss. Nehmt sie vorläufig fest und schickt nach einem Experten aus Europa um den Sachverhalt zu klären.
TEXT.Italian: A grave accusation that must be taken seriously! Impound them, and send for a learned expert from Europe to deliberate the matter.
TEXT.Spanish: A grave accusation that must be taken seriously! Impound them, and send for a learned expert from Europe to deliberate the matter.

TEXT.English: Throw them all into the river. If they float, they are surely agents of the devil! If not, then at least we have proven our piety.
TEXT.French: Jetez les aux fleuves. Si elles flottent, c'est qu'elles sont des envoyées du diable ! Si ce n'est pas le cas, nous aurons au moins prouvé notre piété.
TEXT.German: Werft sie alle gefesselt in den Fluss. Falls sie nicht unter gehen, sind sie mit dem Teufel im Bunde. Falls doch, habe wir wenigstens unsere Gottesfürchtigkeit bewiesen.
TEXT.Italian: Throw them all into the river. If they float, they are surely agents of the devil! If not, then at least we have proven our piety.
TEXT.Spanish: Throw them all into the river. If they float, they are surely agents of the devil! If not, then at least we have proven our piety.

TEXT.English: We should wait until the fish in the school are old enough to breed.
TEXT.French: Nous devons attendre que le poisson arrive à maturité.
TEXT.German: Wir sollten warten bis die Fische des Schwarms ausgewachsen sind.
TEXT.Italian: We should wait until the fish in the swarm have grown out.
TEXT.Spanish: We should wait until the fish in the swarm have grown out.

TEXT.English: We need those fish now. Fill your nets with all you can catch.
TEXT.French: Nous avons besoin de ces poissons maintenant. Remplissez les filets et prenez tout ce que vous pouvez.
TEXT.German: Wir brauchen diese Fische aber bereits jetzt. Füllt eure Netze mit allem, was ihr fangen könnt.
TEXT.Italian: We need those fish now. Fill your nets with all you can catch.
TEXT.Spanish: We need those fish now. Fill your nets with all you can catch.

TEXT.English: All right, let the ragtag pack have their toll. But we have to do something about this rabble. We should hire a few more beadles.
TEXT.French: All right, let the ragtag pack have their toll. But we have to do something about this rabble. We should hire a few more beadles.
TEXT.German: Na schön, das Lumpenpack soll ihren Wegzoll haben. Aber wir müssen dringend was gegen dieses Gesindel tun. Wir sollten noch ein paar Büttel mehr einstellen.
TEXT.Italian: All right, let the ragtag pack have their toll. But we have to do something about this rabble. We should hire a few more beadles.
TEXT.Spanish: All right, let the ragtag pack have their toll. But we have to do something about this rabble. We should hire a few more beadles.

TEXT.English: We cannot give all our gold to these highwaymen. How are we going to pay for the new goods? Let's negotiate, maybe they will settle for less?
TEXT.French: We cannot give all our gold to these highwaymen. How are we going to pay for the new goods? Let's negotiate, maybe they will settle for less?
TEXT.German: Wir können doch diesen Wegelagerern nicht unser ganzes Gold geben. Womit bezahlen wir die neuen Waren. Lasst uns verhandeln, vielleicht geben sie sich auch mit weniger zufrieden?!
TEXT.Italian: InterroWe cannot give all our gold to these highwaymen. How are we going to pay for the new goods? Let's negotiate, maybe they will settle for less?
TEXT.Spanish: We cannot give all our gold to these highwaymen. How are we going to pay for the new goods? Let's negotiate, maybe they will settle for less?

TEXT.English: Pah, we are not going to give a single gold coin to this rabble! We'll send for the militia, they'll show these bandits!
TEXT.French: Pah, we are not going to give a single gold coin to this rabble! We'll send for the militia, they'll show these bandits!
TEXT.German: Pah, wir werden diesem Gesindel keine einzige Goldmünze geben! Wir schicken nach den Bütteln, die werden es diesen Banditen schon zeigen!
TEXT.Italian: Pah, we are not going to give a single gold coin to this rabble! We'll send for the militia, they'll show these bandits!
TEXT.Spanish: Pah, we are not going to give a single gold coin to this rabble! We'll send for the militia, they'll show these bandits!

TEXT.English: Yes, this job is just right for a trading post. Local farmers and Indians will trade with us. This way we will outdo the competition.
TEXT.French: Yes, this job is just right for a trading post. Local farmers and Indians will trade with us. This way we will outdo the competition.
TEXT.German: Ja, diese Stelle ist für einen Handelsposten genau richtig. Ortsansässige Farmer und Indianer werden mit uns Handeln. Damit stechen wir die Konkurrenz aus.
TEXT.Italian: Yes, this job is just right for a trading post. Local farmers and Indians will trade with us. This way we will outdo the competition.
TEXT.Spanish: Yes, this job is just right for a trading post. Local farmers and Indians will trade with us. This way we will outdo the competition.

TEXT.English: This threatens the trade interests of our neighbours. Good neighbourly relations are more important to me.
TEXT.French: This threatens the trade interests of our neighbours. Good neighbourly relations are more important to me.
TEXT.German: Das bedroht die Handelsinteressen unserer Nachbarn. Mir sind die guten nachbarschaftlichen Beziehungen wichtiger.
TEXT.Italian: This threatens the trade interests of our neighbours. Good neighbourly relations are more important to me.
TEXT.Spanish: This threatens the trade interests of our neighbours. Good neighbourly relations are more important to me.

TEXT.English: I don't have time for this now. The trading company should take care of it itself.
TEXT.French: I don't have time for this now. The trading company should take care of it itself.
TEXT.German: Für sowas hab ich jetzt keine Zeit. Die Handelsgesellschaft soll sich gefälligst selbst darum kümmern.
TEXT.Italian: I don't have time for this now. The trading company should take care of it itself.
TEXT.Spanish: I don't have time for this now. The trading company should take care of it itself.

TEXT.English: All right, relationships are important to me. There are other places for a fort. Tear it down!
TEXT.French: All right, relationships are important to me. There are other places for a fort. Tear it down!
TEXT.German: Na schön, die Beziehungen sind mir wichtig. Es gibt noch andere Plätze für ein Fort. Lasst es abreißen!
TEXT.Italian: All right, relationships are important to me. There are other places for a fort. Tear it down!
TEXT.Spanish: All right, relationships are important to me. There are other places for a fort. Tear it down!

TEXT.English: This now threatens our trade interests again. But I am not a brute either. We should share our success with our neighbours.
TEXT.French: This now threatens our trade interests again. But I am not a brute either. We should share our success with our neighbours.
TEXT.German: Das bedroht nun wieder unsere Handelsinteressen. Aber ich bin auch kein Unmensch. Wir sollten unsere Nachbarn an unserem Erfolg teilhaben lassen.
TEXT.Italian: This now threatens our trade interests again. But I am not a brute either. We should share our success with our neighbours.
TEXT.Spanish: This now threatens our trade interests again. But I am not a brute either. We should share our success with our neighbours.

TEXT.English: What do they think they are? We are the ruling power here. Let them go where the pepper grows!
TEXT.French: What do they think they are? We are the ruling power here. Let them go where the pepper grows!
TEXT.German: Für was halten die sich? Wir sind hier die herrschende Macht. Sollen sie dahingehen, wo der Pfeffer wächst!
TEXT.Italian: What do they think they are? We are the ruling power here. Let them go where the pepper grows!
TEXT.Spanish: What do they think they are? We are the ruling power here. Let them go where the pepper grows!

TEXT.English: The King is far away and this decision had to be taken locally in the colonies for the good of our nation.
TEXT.French: The King is far away and this decision had to be taken locally in the colonies for the good of our nation.
TEXT.German: Der König ist weit weg und diese Entscheidung musste vor Ort in den Kolonien zum Wohl unserer Nation getroffen werden.
TEXT.Italian: The King is far away and this decision had to be taken locally in the colonies for the good of our nation.
TEXT.Spanish: The King is far away and this decision had to be taken locally in the colonies for the good of our nation.

TEXT.English: Aye, an excellent spawning ground. No wonder the fish feel at home here. And soon the local fishermen will be doing the same...
TEXT.French: Aye, an excellent spawning ground. No wonder the fish feel at home here. And soon the local fishermen will be doing the same...
TEXT.German: Aye, ein hervorragender Laichgrund. Kein Wunder, dass sich die Fische hier wohlfühlen. Und bald werden es auch die örtlichen Fischer...
TEXT.Italian: Aye, an excellent spawning ground. No wonder the fish feel at home here. And soon the local fishermen will be doing the same...
TEXT.Spanish: Aye, an excellent spawning ground. No wonder the fish feel at home here. And soon the local fishermen will be doing the same...

TEXT.English: Aye, the ship is unsalvageable. These damn shallow waters. Then the ship will at least steer close to shore, maybe we can salvage something from it later!
TEXT.French: Aye, the ship is unsalvageable. These damn shallow waters. Then the ship will at least steer close to shore, maybe we can salvage something from it later!
TEXT.German: Aye, das Schiff ist nicht mehr zu retten. Diese verdammten seichten Gewässer. Dann steuert das Schiff wenigstens in Ufernähe, vielleicht können wir später noch etwas daraus bergen!
TEXT.Italian: Aye, the ship is unsalvageable. These damn shallow waters. Then the ship will at least steer close to shore, maybe we can salvage something from it later!
TEXT.Spanish: Aye, the ship is unsalvageable. These damn shallow waters. Then the ship will at least steer close to shore, maybe we can salvage something from it later!
